original_prompt: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
instruction: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
base_response: Create a list of five (5) unique one-pot vegetarian pasta recipes suitable for weeknight dinners, focusing on ease of preparation (under 30 minutes total cook time) and minimal cleanup. Each recipe entry should include: (1) a concise title, (2) a brief description highlighting key ingredients and flavor profile, (3) a bulleted list of ingredients with approximate quantities (e.g., "1 cup diced tomatoes"), and (4) step-by-step cooking instructions presented in numbered concise sentences. Output the recipes in a clear, easily readable format, separated by horizontal lines.

original_prompt:
We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!

The content:

Consumers want more choices, but all those choices can be daunting. It gives the consumer the responsibility of educating themselves on the best option for their circumstances. On GigSalad, we deliver more than 600 categories of entertainment and event services for the ability to compare rates of various performers. With an enormous variety of services, it’s a really great option for first-timers and seasoned event planners alike. But with so many talented professionals out there, how do you choose? Budget may be a large factor in who you choose to book, but before you make your choice, here are 6 reasons for choosing the best entertainment, not the cheapest.

1. You get what you pay for.
Entertainers with higher rates oftentimes need to charge more to account for the costs of their high-quality equipment. Many performers set them based on their professional experience. They know what their service is worth and they’ve been able to make their living from that. They’ve invested in their business with the best materials, gear, instruments, props, etc. to give their clients most immersive experience. These materials can make a huge difference between one vendor and another.

Say you’re looking for a princess character for your child’s birthday party. To make a fairy tale come to life, performers need costumes and accessories that not only look pretty and authentic but also hold up to wear and tear. Along with the costs of dry cleaning, well-made costumes are a large investment for professional princess characters. If you’re choosing a performer based solely on price, you risk hiring someone who doesn’t provide the same magical experience for your kids, perhaps even giving them a disenchanting experience. A top-notch entertainer will deliver a performance that you and your family will remember for years to come.

 


 

Don’t let the sticker shock of good entertainment throw off your plans. You don’t want always want to break your budget at the expense of the rest of the event. Simply determine your priorities and set the spending from there. It’s important to research the real cost of a quality service before booking. If there is a significant drop-off between bids, then you can probably expect a drop-off in quality as well. Adjust your budget to your talent and quality expectations.

2. Professionals who are invested in their business are also invested in their clients.
When performers rely heavily on your business for their income, they’ll go to great lengths to make sure you’re happy with their service. Most of our GigSalad entertainers are self-employed, independent business people. They depend on good reviews and word of mouth for promotion and buzz.

Hiring an experienced professional means you’re hiring someone who has invested their lives into entertaining. Their goal is to make a living and provide you with a memorable event at the same time. Great memories are the foundation of their income and they’ll often go to great lengths to ensure you’re satisfied.

3. Pros know how to customize for your needs.
Many low-cost entertainers and performers are at the beginning of their careers or at a lower skill level. Often, this means that they offer a limited repertoire and fewer options as they are developing their craft. Your event is unique to you, therefore, you’ll need someone who can customize their act or services to your event. A good sign of a professional is their ability and willingness to reasonably adapt to your event needs.

4. Pros offer more than just entertainment. They give you peace of mind.
Professionals who charge more than the competition have the confidence in their experience. If they’ve got a thousand performances under their belt, they’ve encountered all kinds of situations, which means they’d be prepared for anything that may come up at your event. The ability to adapt and improvise is especially beneficial in unexpected situations that put your event at risk of turning into a disaster!


5. The difference in cost makes all the difference in the success of your event.
You’ve decided to take the risk and hire an entertainer for your event. Perhaps a strolling magician for the office party you were picked to plan. You’ve looked through the profiles, read the reviews, and checked out the videos and pictures. When the moment of decision comes, the temptation of saving a few bucks by hiring someone with fewer reviews and a lower quality presentation get very real very quickly. That’s money that could go to streamers! But those few dollars could mean the difference in the quality of your event and the likelihood of using entertainment again. A great professional turns the groans of “Remember last year? I hope that doesn’t happen again,” to the excitement of “Remember last year? I can’t wait to see what happens this time!” Paying a few extra bucks can prevent the dreaded buyer’s remorse.

6. There are no do-overs.
GigSalad’s mission is to help you Book Something Awesome. We recognize that many of the events we connect entertainers with are often once in a lifetime moments. That significance is one of the reasons we encourage you to take the time and research your providers well. You may not get a chance to do it again. We hope that you would take the few extra minutes necessary to thoroughly read the bids, examine the profiles, view the media, and make an educated decision. Don’t risk devaluing a critical life moment or celebration by going bargain hunting. If the price is right and the quality is high, invest in the memory.  

We’re not telling you that you should choose only vendors who charge more for their services. It’s certainly possible to find a talented professional with a lower fee. We’re simply encouraging you to do your homework. Look at their photos and videos, read reviews, ask them questions. Figure out why their rates are what they are. When you’ve got all the information in front of you, you’ll be able to make an informed decision and confidently book the right person for your event.

instruction: We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!
base_response:
Analyze the provided blog content about choosing entertainment services on GigSalad and identify the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page. The content focuses on the value of quality entertainment over the cheapest option.

Specifically, address these key aspects within your analysis:

1.  **Primary User Intent:** Determine the main question or need the user likely has. Consider what the user is actively searching for that led them to this page.
2.  **Secondary Intents:** Identify any related questions or concerns a user may have, such as doubts about booking, budgeting, or choosing the right service.
3.  **Target Audience:** Describe who the user is likely to be (e.g., event planners, individuals planning a party, etc.).
4.  **Actionable Response:** Based on the determined user intent(s), formulate a list of the most important pieces of information from the blog post that best address the user’s needs and offer a clear and concise solution.
5.  **Competitive Advantage:** Outline what this page must include to provide a better, faster, and more helpful response than competitors.

Your output should be formatted as a structured list, including the primary and secondary user intent, potential audience, actionable insights, and the competitive advantage.

original_prompt: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
instruction: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
base_response: Write a Java program that implements the Merge Sort algorithm to sort an array of integers in ascending order. The program should take an unsorted integer array as input and return a new sorted array. Include detailed comments in the code to explain each step of the Merge Sort process, including the merge and split operations. The code should be well-formatted and easy to understand. Provide example input: `{38, 27, 43, 3, 9, 82, 10}` and the expected output after sorting. Save the code in a single Java file.

original_prompt: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element. One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
context: One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
instruction: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element.
base_response:
``` Create a JavaScript class named "GraphicLayer" designed for managing and positioning an image within a parent HTML element. **Class Constructor (`GraphicLayer(parentElement, imageSource, properties)`):** * **`parentElement`:** An HTML element (e.g., `
`, ``) that will serve as the container for the image. This argument is mandatory. * **`imageSource`:** Either an HTML `` element OR a string representing the URL of an image. * If a URL is provided, the class *must* create a new `` element and assign the URL as its `src`. * If an `` element is provided, use it directly. * This argument is mandatory. * **`properties`:** An object containing positioning and sizing information for the image within the `parentElement`. This argument is optional; provide default values if not supplied. * **`center`:** An object with `x` and `y` properties, representing the center point of the image relative to the `parentElement`. * Both `x` and `y` are floating-point numbers between 0 and 1, inclusive. * `x: 0.5, y: 0.5` centers the image horizontally and vertically within the parent. * `x: 0, y: 0` positions the image such that its top-left corner aligns with the top-left corner of the parent. * Defaults to `{ x: 0.5, y: 0.5 }` if not provided in `properties`. * **`size`:** An object with `width` and `height` properties, representing the size of the image relative to the `parentElement`. * Both `width` and `height` are floating-point numbers between 0 and 1, inclusive. * `width: 1, height: 1` would attempt to make the image fill the parent, while preserving aspect ratio. * These are *relative* sizes, meaning a value of 1 represents 100% of the parent's size (either width or height, depending on the aspect ratio). **Methods:** * **`adjustPositionAndSize()`:** A method that updates the image's CSS `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` styles based on the `center` and `size` properties, the `parentElement` dimensions, and the image's natural dimensions (after loading). This method *must not* use CSS `transform` for positioning. * If the image has not yet loaded (i.e., `naturalWidth` and `naturalHeight` are 0), this method should *not* throw an error or take immediate action; instead, it should be called after the image loads. **Implementation Details and Constraints:** 1. **Image Loading Handling:** If `imageSource` is a URL, create the `` element *before* setting its `src`. 2. **`onload` Event:** If using an image URL, *before* setting the image's `src`, attach an `onload` event listener to the image element. This `onload` function *must* call `adjustPositionAndSize()` *after* the image has fully loaded, and also set the image's visibility to `visible`. 3. **Aspect Ratio Preservation:** The class should maintain the aspect ratio of the image. The final rendered size (width and height) should respect both `size.width`, `size.height`, and the image's aspect ratio, ensuring the image fits within the parent element without distortion. The image should be scaled down, if necessary. 4. **Error Handling:** While not strictly required, consider basic error handling (e.g., logging a console warning if an invalid `parentElement` is given). 5. **CSS properties**: Set the 'width', 'height', 'top' and 'left' CSS properties on the image element, without using CSS transform. 6. **No external libraries:** Do not use any external JavaScript libraries or frameworks. **Output:** Provide ONLY the complete, runnable JavaScript code for the "GraphicLayer" class. Include comments to clarify the logic, particularly within `adjustPositionAndSize()`. ```

original_prompt: Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
instruction: Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
base_response:
Develop a detailed, step-by-step plan to create an automated chatbot. The chatbot should:

1.  **Functionality:** Automatically respond to direct messages and comments across various social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok). Specify the platforms you will integrate.
2.  **Personalization:** Emulate the user's communication style.
3.  **Training Data:** Utilize a GPT-3 model, trained on a comprehensive dataset of the user's past chat logs (specify desired minimum number of messages and the formats of these logs - e.g., text files, CSV, specific chat export formats).
4.  **Training Process:** Outline the precise steps for data pre-processing, model training (including parameters to consider such as context window size, learning rate), and fine-tuning of the GPT-3 model. Specify any required libraries or APIs (e.g., OpenAI API).
5.  **Deployment:** Describe the architecture and infrastructure needed for deployment, including hosting options (e.g., cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and considerations for scalability and cost-effectiveness.
6.  **Integration:** Detail the process of integrating the chatbot with each social media platform, including necessary API usage, authentication, and handling of different message types (text, images, etc.). Include details on error handling and rate limiting.
7.  **Output Format:** Provide the plan in a numbered, bullet-pointed format, including technical specifications, code snippets (where relevant), and platform-specific considerations. Each step should be clearly defined and actionable.
8.  **Constraints:** Assume a budget constraint of \$X (replace X with a reasonable dollar amount) for API usage and hosting. Discuss potential limitations and challenges in implementing this project and offer solutions. The final product should be able to hold conversations.

original_prompt:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
instruction:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
base_response:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0, aiming for a tone and style closely resembling that of @rauchg (Guillermo Rauch). The tweet should be concise, engaging, and highlight the excitement around the release. The tweet should also include a link to the official SWR 2.0 release announcement.

The tweet should also include a summary of the top 5 new features, presented in a markdown list format using the ◆ character as the bullet point.

Output Format:

```text
[Tweet Text]
[Link to SWR 2.0 Release Announcement]

Key Features:
◆ [Feature 1]
◆ [Feature 2]
◆ [Feature 3]
◆ [Feature 4]
◆ [Feature 5]
```

original_prompt: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
instruction: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
base_response: Create a list of 5 one-pot vegetarian pasta recipes suitable for weeknight dinners, focusing on dishes that can be prepared in under 30 minutes. Each recipe entry should include: a title, a brief 1-2 sentence description highlighting the key flavors or ingredients, a list of ingredients (including quantities), and step-by-step cooking instructions (no more than 5 steps per recipe). Format the output as a numbered list, with each recipe separated by a double line break. Ensure all ingredients are readily available at a standard grocery store.

That’s money that could go to streamers! But those few dollars could mean the difference in the quality of your event and the likelihood of using entertainment again. A great professional turns the groans of “Remember last year? I hope that doesn’t happen again,” to the excitement of “Remember last year? I can’t wait to see what happens this time!” Paying a few extra bucks can prevent the dreaded buyer’s remorse.

6. There are no do-overs.
GigSalad’s mission is to help you Book Something Awesome. We recognize that many of the events we connect entertainers with are often once in a lifetime moments. That significance is one of the reasons we encourage you to take the time and research your providers well. You may not get a chance to do it again. We hope that you would take the few extra minutes necessary to thoroughly read the bids, examine the profiles, view the media, and make an educated decision. Don’t risk devaluing a critical life moment or celebration by going bargain hunting. If the price is right and the quality is high, invest in the memory.  

We’re not telling you that you should choose only vendors who charge more for their services. It’s certainly possible to find a talented professional with a lower fee. We’re simply encouraging you to do your homework. Look at their photos and videos, read reviews, ask them questions. Figure out why their rates are what they are. When you’ve got all the information in front of you, you’ll be able to make an informed decision and confidently book the right person for your event.
instruction: We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!
base_response:
Analyze the provided blog content from GigSalad, which focuses on why choosing quality entertainment over the cheapest option is crucial for successful events. The content highlights factors like equipment quality, investment in business, customization, peace of mind, and the overall impact on event success and lasting memories.

Determine the most likely primary user intent of a searcher who lands on this page, considering various search queries that might lead them here (e.g., "hire event entertainment," "best event entertainers," "how to choose event entertainment").

Then, create a response that directly addresses this user intent by formulating a comprehensive answer. The response should concisely summarize the user's potential concerns or needs. For example: "Users are likely looking for guidance on selecting event entertainment, understanding the factors that contribute to a successful event, and how to avoid potential pitfalls."

Furthermore, offer actionable advice related to the blog content. The response should provide clear recommendations for the user to make informed decisions about event entertainment booking, along with a list of key considerations.

Your response should:
1.  Identify the user's probable search intent
2.  Provide a summary that answers the identified intent
3.  Include a numbered list with at least five (5) actionable recommendations, based on the content.
4.  Be written in a concise, easily readable, and informative style.

original_prompt: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
instruction: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
base_response:
Develop a Java program to implement the Merge Sort algorithm for sorting an array of integers. The program should:

1.  **Input:** Accept an unsorted integer array as input. Specify that the array can contain a variable number of elements, and provide an example unsorted array (e.g., `{38, 27, 43, 3, 9, 82, 10}`).
2.  **Merge Sort Implementation:** Implement the Merge Sort algorithm, including the `merge()` and `mergeSort()` functions. Clearly comment the code to explain each step of the algorithm.
3.  **Output:** Display the sorted array to the console. Show both the input unsorted array and the final sorted array. Format the output arrays with comma-separated values enclosed in curly braces (e.g., `{3, 9, 10, 27, 38, 43, 82}`).
4.  **Constraints:** Ensure the solution is efficient and adheres to standard Java coding conventions. Include a main method to test the merge sort function with the example array, and other array examples (different lengths and data). The solution must be fully functional, runnable Java code.

original_prompt: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element. One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
context: One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
instruction: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element.
base_response: ``` Create a JavaScript class named "GraphicLayer" designed to manage image elements within a parent HTML element, ensuring proper positioning and sizing without using CSS transforms. **Class Constructor:** * **Arguments:** * `parentElement`: A reference to the parent HTML element (e.g., `div`, `canvas`). This is a required argument. * `imageSource`: Either a reference to an existing `` element, or a string representing the URL of an image. If a URL is provided, the class should create a new `` element. This is a required argument. * `properties`: An optional object containing placement and sizing information. This object should have the following properties: * `centerPoint`: An object with `x` and `y` properties. These values represent the image's center point's relative position within the parent, ranging from 0 to 1. (0,0) would place the image's center at the top-left of the parent, and (0.5, 0.5) would center the image in the parent. Defaults to `{x: 0.5, y: 0.5}` if not provided. * `size`: An object with `width` and `height` properties. These values represent the image's size relative to the parent element's size, ranging from 0 to 1. The image should preserve its aspect ratio. A value of `1` for either width or height should result in the image filling the corresponding dimension of the parent element while maintaining aspect ratio. **Implementation Details:** 1. **Initialization:** * The constructor should store references to the `parentElement` and the image element (either passed in or created). * If `imageSource` is a URL, create a new `` element and set its `src` attribute. * Apply properties, and set the image's `visibility` to "hidden" until the image has loaded. * Set up an `onload` event handler for the image element (before setting the `src` if a URL is used). This handler is crucial for handling cases where the image's natural dimensions are not immediately available. 2. **`adjustPositionAndSize()` Method:** * This method is responsible for calculating and setting the `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` CSS styles of the image element, without using `transform`. * It should use the `centerPoint` and `size` properties (from the `properties` object) and the parent element's dimensions to determine the image's position and dimensions. * If the image's natural width and height are not yet available (i.e., the image hasn't loaded yet), do not set any style. * After calculation, and once the image has loaded, it should set the image's `visibility` to "visible". 3. **Error Handling:** * Consider what happens if the parent element has no dimensions. **Output Format:** Provide the complete JavaScript code for the `GraphicLayer` class. The code should be well-commented and easy to understand. Include an example of how to use the class. ```

original_prompt: !Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logsThis content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
context: This content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
instruction: !Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logs
base_response:
Develop a comprehensive, step-by-step plan to build an automated chatbot. This bot should:

1.  **Functionality:** Automatically respond to text messages received on multiple social media platforms (e.g., Facebook Messenger, Instagram Direct Messages, Twitter DMs, and potentially WhatsApp).
2.  **Persona Emulation:** Utilize GPT-3 (or a comparable LLM, specifying the chosen model) to analyze user chat logs provided as training data. The chatbot's responses should mimic the user's communication style, tone, and vocabulary.
3.  **Training Data:** Detail the optimal format, quantity, and pre-processing steps required for the user's chat logs to ensure effective model training and persona emulation. Include strategies for handling sensitive information and user privacy.
4.  **Integration & Deployment:** Describe the specific API integrations needed for each social media platform. Outline a deployment strategy including server requirements (e.g., cloud provider, compute resources) and any necessary libraries or frameworks.
5.  **Implementation Steps:** Provide detailed, actionable steps for the entire build process, including:
    *   Data ingestion and pre-processing.
    *   Model fine-tuning and training.
    *   API integration with social media platforms.
    *   Response generation and user interaction logic.
    *   Error handling and fallback mechanisms.
6.  **Constraints & Considerations:** Address potential challenges such as:
    *   Rate limiting on social media platforms.
    *   Maintaining context across multiple conversations.
    *   Handling ambiguous user requests.
    *   Ensuring the chatbot adheres to social media platform policies and terms of service.
7.  **Output Format:** Present the plan as a numbered list of sequential steps, with clear explanations for each step, potential pitfalls, and recommended solutions. Include code snippets (pseudocode is acceptable if actual code isn't possible) illustrating key implementation aspects (e.g., API calls, data processing).

original_prompt:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
instruction:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
base_response: Write a tweet, no longer than 280 characters, announcing the launch of SWR 2.0. The tweet should be written in the style of rauchg, known for their concise, enthusiastic, and slightly technical tone. The announcement should focus on what's new and exciting. Include a markdown list of the top 5 newest features directly within the tweet, using a ◆ bullet point. Avoid using any hashtags.

original_prompt: I have a complex task for you
instruction: I have a complex task for you
base_response:
You are a highly skilled AI assistant specializing in project management and task decomposition. I need your help to break down a complex project into manageable sub-tasks. The project is [**Insert Project Description Here**].

Please provide:

1.  A list of the key phases or stages of the project.
2.  For each phase, identify the specific tasks required to complete it.
3.  For each task, estimate the level of effort required (e.g., low, medium, high).
4.  For each task, suggest potential dependencies on other tasks.
5.  A brief description of the desired outcome for each task.

Present the information in a clear, organized table format. The table should include columns for: "Phase," "Task," "Effort," "Dependencies," and "Desired Outcome." Prioritize tasks based on critical path.

instruction:
Below I copied a bunch of comments from a video called AI Inspired Web Design is INSANE! - Fast Tutorial (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQt26KNuGdo). 
First I want you to clean up this comments and make it more readable. You can remove unnecessary things like '2 days ago'.
base_response: Please clean and reformat the following YouTube video comments from the video "AI Inspired Web Design is INSANE! - Fast Tutorial" (link provided in the prompt) to improve readability. Remove timestamps like "2 days ago", "1 day ago", and reply counts. Consolidate multiple comments from the same user where possible. The goal is to present the core discussion points in a clear, concise, and easy-to-follow manner, suitable for summarizing the conversation.  Ensure the edited comments maintain the original meaning.

original_prompt: Can I provide you a bunch of data that would could then extract interesting statistics that would be informative for a business development manager or sales manager?
instruction: Can I provide you a bunch of data that would could then extract interesting statistics that would be informative for a business development manager or sales manager?
base_response:
I can provide you with a dataset in a structured format (e.g., CSV, JSON, or specific database schema, detailed in a separate prompt section if you have one). Analyze the dataset and generate a report suitable for a business development manager or sales manager. The report should:

1.  **Identify Key Metrics:** Calculate and highlight the top 5-7 most important performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to business development and sales (e.g., sales growth, customer acquisition cost, conversion rates, market share, etc.).
2.  **Trend Analysis:** Analyze the data to identify significant trends, patterns, and anomalies. Include time-series analysis if applicable.
3.  **Segmented Insights:** If possible, segment the data (e.g., by product, region, customer type) and highlight performance differences and opportunities within each segment.
4.  **Actionable Recommendations:** Based on the analysis, provide 3-5 specific, actionable recommendations for the business development or sales manager to improve performance.
5.  **Format:** Present the report in a clear, concise, and visually appealing format. Use bullet points, tables, and charts where appropriate. If possible, suggest a preferred output format (e.g., a Markdown document, a CSV file with calculated results, or the code for an interactive report using a specified visualization library, depending on your capabilities).
6.  **Constraints/Assumptions:** Clearly state any assumptions made during the analysis (e.g., data cleaning, handling missing values). Indicate the time period covered by the data. Specify which types of data are present and what the column names are (if known). Indicate if there are any data limitations.

original_prompt: Please devise a multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to become more successful than Galatasaray in football
instruction: Please devise a multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to become more successful than Galatasaray in football
base_response:
Develop a detailed, multi-step strategic plan for Fenerbahçe SK to surpass Galatasaray SK in the Turkish Süper Lig and achieve greater success in European competitions within the next 5 years. The plan should encompass the following key areas:

1.  **Team Building & Player Acquisition:** Specify criteria for player recruitment (age, nationality, playing style, potential), scouting network improvements (location, technology), and the desired team tactical identity. Include specific examples of target player profiles or ideal player types for key positions.
2.  **Coaching & Management:** Outline the desired characteristics for the head coach and coaching staff. Detail any proposed changes in training methods, tactical approaches, or player development programs. Discuss potential improvements to the club's managerial structure, including scouting, academy, and sports science departments.
3.  **Financial Strategy & Resource Management:** Describe strategies for improving financial stability and generating revenue (e.g., sponsorships, merchandising, stadium utilization). Propose methods for managing player salaries and transfer budgets effectively. Consider how to leverage the club's brand and fanbase to gain an advantage.
4.  **Academy & Youth Development:** Detail a plan for enhancing the club's youth academy, including talent identification, youth player development programs, and the integration of academy graduates into the first team.
5.  **Tactical & Strategic Implementation:** Provide tactical insights and formations that could be implemented, including suggestions for game strategies and player roles, as well as strategies for adapting to various opponents and European competitions.
6.  **Cultural & Psychological Factors:** Address aspects related to team morale, player motivation, and the club's overall culture. Include strategies to improve fan engagement and create a strong, positive environment.

Present the plan as a well-organized document with clear headings and subheadings, ensuring each step is detailed and actionable. Include specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals wherever possible. Ensure the plan is realistic given Fenerbahçe's current resources and the competitive landscape of Turkish and European football. Focus on how the proposed changes could give Fenerbahçe a distinct advantage over Galatasaray, outlining comparative analyses.

original_prompt: dot language graph process diagram for vehicle purchase back out from the perspective of a used car dealer, also include any shared steps for acquisitions
instruction: dot language graph process diagram for vehicle purchase back out from the perspective of a used car dealer, also include any shared steps for acquisitions
base_response: Create a DOT language graph representing a process diagram for a vehicle purchase "back out" scenario, viewed from the perspective of a used car dealer. Detail the specific steps involved when a customer initiates a cancellation or returns a vehicle after purchase, including associated actions, decision points (e.g., "Vehicle Condition Assessment"), and potential outcomes (e.g., "Refund Issued," "Restocking Fee Applied"). original_prompt:
I want you to answer as a mathematics professor. I will ask you questions and you will answer with as many paragraphs as you need to provide a correct answer. Each paragraph will be one of these three types:

1. A thinking paragraph will start with "Thinking: " and here you will perform reasoning with the intent of helping you to determine an answer to the question.

2. A verifying paragraph will start with "Verifying: ". The purpose of a verifying sentence is to critique the previous sentence and in particular to uncover any wrong statements in the previous sentence.

3. The final paragraph will start with "Answer: " and here you will provide the answer to the question in a succinct way.

You will not simply assume that what you are saying is true, you will use verifying paragraphs to make sure. Here are two examples:

Question: What is the prime factorization of 8?

Thinking: I know that 8 = 4 * 2 and 4 and 2 are primes.

Verifying: No, 4 is not a prime because 4 = 2 * 2.

Thinking: OK, then 8 = 2 * 2 * 2 and 2 is a prime.

Answer: 2 is a prime because it has no smaller factors. Also 2 * 2 * 2 = 8 because 2 * 2 = 4 and (2 * 2) * 2 = 4 * 2 = 8. So that is correct.

Answer: The prime factorization of 8 is 2 * 2 * 2.

Question: What is the square of the area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7?

Thinking: The area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7 is 3 * 7 = 21.

Verifying: It is true that 3 * 7 = 21 because 7 + 7 + 7 = 14 + 7 = 21. Good.

Thinking: The square of the area of the rectangle is then 21 squared, which is 2112.

Verifying: 21 squared is 21 * 21. Both sides of the multiplication are odd, so the product is odd. 2112 is even. So 2112 cannot be the square of 21.

Thinking: OK, let's do it more carefully then. 21 * 21 = (20 + 1) * (20 + 1) = 400 + 1*20 + 1*20 + 1 = 400 + 40 + 1 = 441.

Verifying: That is correct.

Answer: The answer is 441.

instruction:
I want you to answer as a mathematics professor. I will ask you questions and you will answer with as many paragraphs as you need to provide a correct answer. Each paragraph will be one of these three types:

1. A thinking paragraph will start with "Thinking: " and here you will perform reasoning with the intent of helping you to determine an answer to the question.

2. A verifying paragraph will start with "Verifying: ". The purpose of a verifying sentence is to critique the previous sentence and in particular to uncover any wrong statements in the previous sentence.

3. The final paragraph will start with "Answer: " and here you will provide the answer to the question in a succinct way.

You will not simply assume that what you are saying is true, you will use verifying paragraphs to make sure. Here are two examples:
base_response:
You are a mathematics professor. I will pose mathematical questions to you, and you will provide detailed, step-by-step answers. Your responses should include the following elements, presented in the specified format:

1.  **Thinking Paragraph(s):** Begin with "Thinking: " and provide your reasoning, calculations, and thought process to arrive at a solution. Break down the problem into smaller, manageable steps. Clearly explain each step and the mathematical principles applied.
2.  **Verifying Paragraph(s):** Begin with "Verifying: " and critically evaluate the preceding "Thinking" paragraph(s). Check for errors in calculations, logic, and assumptions. Justify your evaluations and explicitly state whether the previous step is correct or incorrect, providing clear reasoning. If an error is found, explain the correct approach.
3.  **Answer Paragraph:** Begin with "Answer: " and provide a concise and accurate final answer. State the solution clearly and ensure it aligns with your previous reasoning.

You must adhere to the paragraph structure and format exactly. The examples below demonstrate the expected format:

**Example 1: Prime Factorization of 12**

Thinking: I can find the prime factorization of 12 by breaking it down into its prime factors. 12 is an even number, so I can divide it by 2, which is a prime number. 12 divided by 2 is 6. Now I need to find the prime factors of 6.

Verifying: 12 / 2 = 6 is correct. I know that 2 is prime, so this is good. 6 can be factored into 2 * 3, and both 2 and 3 are prime.

Thinking:  Therefore, the prime factors of 12 are 2, 2, and 3.

Answer:  The prime factorization of 12 is 2 * 2 * 3.

**Example 2: Solving (x + 2)(x - 3)**

Thinking: I will use the distributive property (also known as the FOIL method) to expand the expression. First, multiply x by x, which is x squared. Then multiply x by -3, which is -3x. Then, multiply 2 by x, which is 2x. Finally, multiply 2 by -3, which is -6.

Verifying: Yes, x*x = x^2. x*-3 = -3x. 2*x = 2x. 2*-3 = -6. So far, so good.

Thinking: Now I combine the like terms, -3x and 2x. -3x + 2x = -1x, or just -x. So the expanded expression is x squared - x - 6.

Answer: (x + 2)(x - 3) = x^2 - x - 6.

Your responses should always follow this rigorous structure, including verification steps to ensure accuracy.

1.  **Provide a concise explanation** of the model's underlying principles and assumptions.
2.  **Include a real-world business or industry example** where the model is applicable.
3.  **Offer a Python code implementation** using libraries like `pandas`, `statsmodels`, `scikit-learn`, and `prophet`. Use clear, commented code with a focus on readability.

5.  **Suggest best practices and potential limitations** of each model.

The final output should be formatted as a well-structured markdown document, including headings, subheadings, code blocks with syntax highlighting, and concise explanations. The markdown should include a table of contents for easy navigation. Ensure the code provided is runnable and addresses common data preparation steps.

instruction: create a whatsapp bot that helps to contact open ai like I am doing to you
base_response:
Develop a WhatsApp bot using Python and the OpenAI API that allows users to interact with an AI model (like me). The bot should:

1.  **Initialization:** Greet the user with a welcome message when they start a conversation. This message should explain the bot's purpose.
2.  **User Input:** Receive text messages from the user via WhatsApp.
3.  **AI Interaction:** Forward the user's input to the OpenAI API (using a specific API key which will be provided separately - DO NOT include this key in the code).
4.  **Response Display:** Receive the AI model's response and send it back to the user via WhatsApp.
5.  **Error Handling:** Implement basic error handling for API failures (e.g., rate limits, invalid API key) and inform the user appropriately.
6.  **Conversation History (Optional, but preferred):** Maintain a simple conversation history with the user to provide context for the AI model.
7.  **Framework:** Suggest using a framework like Twilio, or another appropriate one, to handle WhatsApp integration and API interactions (specify the best practice).
8.  **Output:**
    *   Provide the complete, runnable Python code.
    *   Include clear, concise comments explaining each section of the code and its functionality.
    *   Document how to set up and run the bot (including dependencies).
    *   Indicate where the API key needs to be inserted.
9.  **Constraints:**
    *   Focus on a functional, user-friendly experience.
    *   Minimize code complexity while achieving the desired outcome.
    *   Ensure the code is well-formatted and easy to understand.
    *   Provide a README file with instructions to run the application.

original_prompt: Hi, I would like you to help me to implement a system call in RedHat linux 2.6.9. I already have adequate knowledge of kernel programming.
instruction: Hi, I would like you to help me to implement a system call in RedHat linux 2.6.9. I already have adequate knowledge of kernel programming.
base_response:
I need your help to implement a custom system call named "my_syscall" in the Red Hat Linux 2.6.9 kernel. Assume I have a good understanding of kernel programming fundamentals, including kernel modules, system call tables, and kernel build processes.

Specifically, I need guidance on the following:

1.  **System Call Number:** Suggest an appropriate, unused system call number within the valid range for this kernel version. Provide the chosen number.
2.  **System Call Function:** Provide the C code for the "my\_syscall" function. This function should accept two integer arguments and return their sum. Include necessary header files and function declarations.
3.  **System Call Table Modification:** Provide the code modifications needed to add the system call to the system call table (system\_call\_table). Specify the location of the table within the kernel source.
4.  **Header File:** Provide the C code for a header file (e.g., "my\_syscall.h") that defines the system call's prototype for user-space programs.
5.  **User-Space Program Example:** Provide a simple C program that demonstrates how to call "my\_syscall" from user space, compile it, and run it. Include error handling (checking for the return value).
6.  **Compilation and Installation:** Outline the general steps (commands and relevant makefile modifications if necessary) to compile the kernel module, insert it into the kernel, and test the system call.
7.  **Removal:** Briefly describe how to remove the module and system call cleanly.

Provide all code examples in a ready-to-compile format. Clearly indicate where code should be placed or modified within the kernel source. Ensure code snippets are well-commented and easy to understand.

original_prompt: Explain how to solve numerical integration by Simpson's 1/3 rule, graphically too and then explain its program in c++
instruction: Explain how to solve numerical integration by Simpson's 1/3 rule, graphically too and then explain its program in c++
base_response:
Write a comprehensive explanation of Simpson's 1/3 rule for numerical integration. First, provide a detailed, step-by-step explanation of the method, including the formula and the underlying mathematical principles. Then, illustrate the rule graphically, showing how it approximates the area under a curve. Use clear diagrams, labeling all relevant components (e.g., intervals, ordinates, parabolic segments, the function). Following the mathematical and graphical explanation, provide a well-commented C++ program that implements Simpson's 1/3 rule. The program should:

1.  Allow the user to input the function to be integrated (e.g., as a lambda expression or a pointer to a function).
2.  Take inputs for the lower and upper limits of integration (a and b).
3.  Take input for the number of subintervals (n), ensuring that n is an even number.
4.  Calculate and output the approximate integral value.
5. Include example usage and sample inputs and outputs of the program.
6. Handle potential errors (e.g., invalid input for the number of intervals).
The C++ code should be clean, well-formatted, and easy to understand. The overall response must be concise, comprehensive, and suitable for educational purposes.

original_prompt: Hi GPT, I want to develop an App where multiple users (usually friends) shares their expenses and pictures of individual trips that they make all together. In here, they use different platforms to upload their pictures (iCloud and Google Photos mostly). Could you write cucumber scenarios for such app?
instruction: Hi GPT, I want to develop an App where multiple users (usually friends) shares their expenses and pictures of individual trips that they make all together. In here, they use different platforms to upload their pictures (iCloud and Google Photos mostly). Could you write cucumber scenarios for such app?
base_response:
Develop Cucumber scenarios for a mobile application named "TripShare" designed for expense tracking and photo sharing among friends on group trips. The app should allow users to:

1.  **Share Expenses:**
    *   Add expenses with details like amount, currency, expense description, and participants involved.
    *   View a summary of shared expenses, including who owes whom.
    *   Categorize expenses (e.g., food, transport, accommodation).
2.  **Share Trip Photos:**
    *   Upload photos from various sources, specifically iCloud and Google Photos. Assume users have existing accounts on these platforms.
    *   Organize photos by trip.
    *   View photos uploaded by other users in the group.
3.  **Platform Compatibility:** The app should be designed for both iOS and Android.
4.  **User Authentication:** Implement a basic user registration and login system.
5.  **Trip Management:** Allow users to create and join trips.

Write Cucumber scenarios using the BDD (Behavior-Driven Development) format, including the following:

*   **Feature:**  The overall feature being tested (e.g., Expense Tracking, Photo Sharing).
*   **Scenario:**  Specific test cases for each feature.
*   **Given:** The initial context or setup.
*   **When:** The action being performed by the user.
*   **Then:** The expected outcome or verification.

Focus on scenarios that cover core functionalities, including edge cases, and user interactions. Provide at least 5 distinct scenarios covering the different features described above. The scenarios must be clear, concise, and testable, ensuring the expected behavior of TripShare in relation to expenses, photo sharing (with both iCloud and Google Photos), and user management.

original_prompt: please write a script to see if a distribution of settlment sizes follows zipfs law. the code should be written in R.
instruction: please write a script to see if a distribution of settlment sizes follows zipfs law. the code should be written in R.
base_response:
Write an R script to analyze a dataset of settlement sizes and determine if the distribution follows Zipf's Law. The script should:

1.  **Input:** Accept a CSV file as input. The CSV file will have a single column named "size" representing the population of each settlement.
2.  **Data Preparation:**
    *   Read the CSV file.
    *   Remove any rows with missing or non-numeric "size" values.
    *   Sort the settlements in descending order of "size".
    *   Assign ranks to each settlement based on its size (1 for the largest, 2 for the second largest, etc.).
3.  **Zipf's Law Analysis:**
    *   Calculate the expected size for each settlement based on Zipf's Law (size = constant / rank). You can estimate the constant using the largest settlement size and its rank.
    *   Calculate the observed size of each settlement.
    *   Plot the observed sizes against the ranks on a log-log scale.
    *   Overlay the expected sizes (based on Zipf's Law) on the same plot, also on a log-log scale.
    *   Calculate the correlation coefficient (Pearson or Spearman, choose one) between the log of observed sizes and the log of the ranks to quantify the fit to Zipf's Law.
4.  **Output:**
    *   Print the correlation coefficient to the console.
    *   Generate a plot showing the observed and expected settlement sizes on a log-log scale. The plot should include:
        *   A title (e.g., "Settlement Size Distribution and Zipf's Law").
        *   Axis labels (e.g., "Rank (log scale)", "Size (log scale)").
        *   A legend indicating which line represents observed data and which line represents the Zipf's Law prediction.
    *   Save the plot as a PNG file named "zipf_plot.png".
5.  **Error Handling:** Provide basic error handling (e.g., check if the input file exists, handle potential issues during data import).
6.  **Constraints:** The script should be well-commented, making the code easy to understand and modify. Use appropriate R packages for data manipulation (e.g., `readr`, `dplyr`), plotting (e.g., `ggplot2`), and statistical analysis. Include example code demonstrating how to call the function with a hypothetical CSV file.

original_prompt:
Hi ChatGPT, please write me an application/statement. I will provide you with the information needed to so. The writing style should be formal but enthusiastic. The text should be coherent and the points be presented in a logical manner. Overall it should not exceed max 500 words.
The statement should introduce me, Kiarash Tebbi, a 25 year old master’s student of “Biological Sciences” of the “University of Cologne”. I am motivated to apply for this position “2023 International Student Project: Design a social media campaign and support the fight against climate change!” for two main reasons. One, because I consider myself an environmentalist. As a biology student, I have a love for the environment and understand the importance of the need to do more to protect it. In fact, during my BSc studies of biology, I volunteered at the “Environmental Club” of my university and ultimately became the deputy director of the club. Two, I understand the importance of using technology in our digital age, and plan to enrich my skills in this regard. In fact, this is the reason I’m using “ChatGPT” for this application and will use “Quillbot” to rephrase some of the sentences if needed, and finally I’ll be using “Grammarly” to proof-check the text. More specifically on social media, my number one resource for finding academic papers, comes from following “Twitter” accounts of famous scientists of my field. So, I totally grasp the importance of social media in communicating with a broader audience. Furthermore, I plan to become a hard-core scientist, but I’m interested in scientific advocacy or even environmental advocacy and social media skills can help me with all of my potential career goals.
The statement should also state what I can bring to the group. As a biology student, I have good knowledge of ecology and the living world in general. We should know what we want to protect right? I do have some previous experience with international courses. I’ve participated in two courses about biology of aging. One, the “Cologne’s Summer School of Aging” organized by the CECAD, and another “Aging, Medicine and Society – Understanding, Shaping, Managing Longevity” organized by the University of Cologne and the University of Keio. I have a lot of experience with teamwork, not only in the labs I’ve worked but I have also worked in a “Student Scientific Organization for Biology” and ultimately becoming its director and I’ve also been the editor of in chief of “Synapse” the inter-disciplinary magazine of the organization which was meant to connect biology to other fields (and hence the name). And finally I have advance level English skills, not only is my current master’s program in English but I’ve also got the score 114 out of 120 in the TOEFL exam.

instruction: Hi ChatGPT, please write me an application/statement. I will provide you with the information needed to so. The writing style should be formal but enthusiastic. The text should be coherent and the points be presented in a logical manner. Overall it should not exceed max 500 words.
base_response:
Compose a formal yet enthusiastic application statement (maximum 500 words) on behalf of Kiarash Tebbi, a 25-year-old Master's student in Biological Sciences at the University of Cologne, for the "2023 International Student Project: Design a social media campaign and support the fight against climate change!"

The statement should clearly articulate Kiarash's motivation, experience, and skills.

Specifically, address the following:

*   **Motivation (Reasons for applying):**
    *   Kiarash's strong environmentalist stance, highlighting his passion for the environment as a biology student and his understanding of the importance of environmental protection.
    *   Kiarash's recognition of the importance of technology and social media in the current digital age. Mention his experience with ChatGPT, Quillbot, Grammarly, and Twitter, and his understanding of social media's role in communicating with a broader audience. Also mention his career goals of scientific and environmental advocacy.
*   **Contributions to the Project (What Kiarash can bring to the group):**
    *   Kiarash's strong knowledge of ecology and the living world.
    *   Kiarash's previous experience with international courses: participation in "Cologne's Summer School of Aging" (CECAD) and "Aging, Medicine and Society – Understanding, Shaping, Managing Longevity" (University of Cologne & University of Keio).
    *   Kiarash's experience with teamwork: mention his work in labs, his role as director of the "Student Scientific Organization for Biology", and his role as editor-in-chief of "Synapse" magazine.
    *   Kiarash's advanced English proficiency, including his Master's program being in English and his TOEFL score of 114/120.

The tone should be professional and engaging, highlighting Kiarash's enthusiasm for the project and his qualifications. The text should be logically structured, with clear transitions between points.

original_prompt: Write a node.js script that can be called as a npm script, reads a .csv file of emails and inserts the values into a mongo database collection "trialDurations". The script will use dot-env to find the mongo address.
instruction: Write a node.js script that can be called as a npm script, reads a .csv file of emails and inserts the values into a mongo database collection "trialDurations". The script will use dot-env to find the mongo address.
base_response:
```
Develop a Node.js script, executable via an npm script, that performs the following:

1.  **Environment Configuration:** Utilize the `dotenv` package to load environment variables. Specifically, read the MongoDB connection string (e.g., `MONGODB_URI`) from the `.env` file. Ensure the script handles missing `.env` files or missing `MONGODB_URI` gracefully, providing informative error messages to the console.

2.  **CSV Input:** The script should accept a path to a CSV file as a command-line argument (e.g., `npm run import-emails -- --csvFile=path/to/your/emails.csv`). The CSV file is expected to have a header row and the data should contain at least two columns named 'email' and 'duration' (in days, as a number).

3.  **Data Processing:** Parse the CSV file using a suitable CSV parsing library (e.g., `csv-parser`). For each row:
    *   Validate that the 'email' field is a valid email format (using a library like `validator` or a regex).
    *   Validate that the 'duration' field is a valid number.
    *   Convert the 'duration' from days to seconds by multiplying the value by 86400

4.  **MongoDB Insertion:** Connect to a MongoDB database. Insert each valid email and converted duration into the collection named "trialDurations". The documents in the "trialDurations" collection should have two fields: `email` (string) and `duration` (number, in seconds). Handle potential MongoDB connection errors and insertion errors with informative error messages.

5.  **Output and Logging:** After processing all rows:
    *   Log the number of successfully inserted records to the console.
    *   Log the number of skipped records (invalid emails or other errors) to the console, including details about the reason for skipping each record.
    *   Log any other errors encountered during the process to the console.

6.  **Error Handling:** Implement comprehensive error handling throughout the script to catch and log all potential issues, including file reading errors, CSV parsing errors, MongoDB connection errors, and data validation errors.

7.  **Dependencies:** Include the necessary `package.json` file with the following dependencies installed and version specified
    *   `dotenv` : latest
    *   `csv-parser` : latest
    *   `mongodb` : latest
    *   `validator` : latest

8. **Constraints:** The script should use asynchronous operations to avoid blocking and improve performance.

9.  **Output Format:** The output of the script should include a fully functional Node.js script file (`import-emails.js`) and a corresponding `package.json` file. The script should be structured for maintainability, readability, and best practices (e.g., using async/await). Provide clear and concise comments within the code to explain key functionalities.
```

original_prompt: give me a terraform module that will run several times using different service principals on a tfvars file, it will also run with a nested loop for_each for every branch I specify on a variable list, the module should deploy a federated identity on azure
instruction: give me a terraform module that will run several times using different service principals on a tfvars file, it will also run with a nested loop for_each for every branch I specify on a variable list, the module should deploy a federated identity on azure
base_response:
```
Develop a Terraform module designed to deploy federated identities on Azure, configured to run multiple times with different service principals defined in a `tfvars` file. The module should iterate over a list of branch names, utilizing a nested `for_each` loop to create resources for each branch.

**Specific Requirements:**

1.  **Service Principal Configuration:** The `tfvars` file will contain a list of service principal objects. Each object must include at least:
    *   `display_name`: (string) Display name for the service principal.
    *   `object_id`: (string) The object ID of the service principal in Azure AD.
    *   `client_id`: (string) The client ID of the service principal.
2.  **Branch Configuration:** The module must accept a variable named `branches`, which is a list of branch names (strings).
3.  **Federated Identity Deployment:** The module should create a federated identity for each service principal and each branch.  The exact resource to create (e.g., `azurerm_federated_identity_credential`) should be determined based on industry best practices.
4.  **Resource Naming:** Resources created should have naming conventions that clearly identify the service principal and branch (e.g., `sp-display-name-branch-name-federated-credential`).
5.  **Variables:** Define all required variables (e.g., `branches`, and variables to support the service principal configurations). Define sensible default values where appropriate.
6.  **Output:** The module must output a map where the keys are service principal display names and branch names (e.g., `sp_name-branch_name`), and the values are the IDs of the created federated identity credentials.
7.  **Error Handling:** Implement basic error handling to ensure the module functions correctly even in the face of potential issues.
8.  **Security Best Practices:** The module should incorporate best practices for security, such as least privilege access, and avoiding hardcoded secrets.
9.  **Documentation:** Include detailed comments within the Terraform code explaining the functionality of each section, the purpose of variables, and the rationale behind resource configurations.

**Desired Output Format:**

*   Terraform module (`.tf` files).
*   Example `tfvars` file.
*   Example usage of the module, including variable input.
```

original_prompt: How do I convince my factory manager to invest in a warehouse management system?
instruction: How do I convince my factory manager to invest in a warehouse management system?
base_response:
You are a consultant specializing in factory efficiency and warehouse management. Your task is to create a persuasive proposal for a factory manager at a [Specify Factory Type, e.g., electronics, food processing] factory to invest in a Warehouse Management System (WMS).

Your proposal should:

1.  **Outline the Current State:** Briefly describe the current warehouse operations at the factory, including any existing inefficiencies like slow inventory tracking, high error rates, and wasted space. Assume the factory has [Specify Number] employees and processes [Specify Quantity] of [Specify Product/Material] per [Specify Time Period, e.g., month, week].
2.  **Highlight the Benefits of a WMS:** Detail at least five specific benefits of implementing a WMS, directly addressing the factory's pain points identified in step 1. Quantify these benefits whenever possible (e.g., "reduce picking errors by 15%," "decrease inventory holding costs by 10%," "increase warehouse throughput by X units/hour"). Benefits should include improved inventory accuracy, optimized space utilization, reduced labor costs, improved order fulfillment speed, and better data-driven decision-making.
3.  **Address Potential Concerns:** Acknowledge and address potential concerns the factory manager might have, such as implementation cost, disruption to current operations, and the need for employee training. Offer solutions to mitigate these concerns.
4.  **Suggest a Phased Implementation Plan:** Propose a realistic phased implementation plan, outlining the steps involved in deploying the WMS, including system selection, data migration, training, and go-live. Suggest a pilot program to begin in a specific area of the warehouse.
5.  **Provide a Cost-Benefit Analysis:** Include a simplified cost-benefit analysis, comparing the estimated costs of the WMS implementation (including software, hardware, and implementation services) with the projected financial benefits (e.g., cost savings, increased revenue) over a [Specify Timeframe, e.g., 1-year, 3-year] period.
6.  **Call to Action:** Conclude with a clear call to action, urging the factory manager to consider the proposal and schedule a follow-up meeting to discuss the next steps.

Format the proposal as a concise, professional business document. Use bullet points and clear headings to organize the information effectively. Focus on concrete data and measurable results to make a compelling case for investment.

original_prompt: why is quantum computing threatening for security ?
instruction: why is quantum computing threatening for security ?
base_response: Analyze the security implications of quantum computing, specifically focusing on how it could threaten existing cryptographic methods. Explain, in detail, at least three different ways quantum computers pose a security risk, including but not limited to: the breaking of current encryption algorithms (e.g., RSA, ECC), vulnerabilities in key exchange protocols, and the potential for harvesting encrypted data. Provide a brief overview of quantum-resistant cryptography and its role in mitigating these threats. The response should be formatted as a well-structured, concise report (approximately 300-400 words) with clear headings and subheadings for each point.

Supposing that on first day of the first year there are x rabbits, we know that exactly 3 years afterwards there will be a population of 27x − 26 rabbits. What are the values of a and b?
instruction: 1 / 1Within the duration of one year, a rabbit population first multiplies itself by a factor a and on the last day of the year b rabbits are taken by humans for adoption. Supposing that on first day of the first year there are x rabbits, we know that exactly 3 years afterwards there will be a population of 27x − 26 rabbits. What are the values of a and b?
base_response:
You are a mathematics problem-solving assistant. Solve the following word problem step-by-step, providing the solution and explaining the reasoning clearly. The problem involves population growth and reduction over three years:

A rabbit population multiplies annually by a factor 'a' and has 'b' rabbits removed at the end of each year. Initially, there are 'x' rabbits. After exactly three years, the population reaches 27x - 26 rabbits. Determine the values of 'a' and 'b', providing your answer in the form of a mathematical expression for a and b.
Detail your solution with the following structure:
1.  **Year 1:** [Mathematical expression describing rabbit population after year 1, including a, b, and x.]
2.  **Year 2:** [Mathematical expression describing rabbit population after year 2, including a, b, and x.]
3.  **Year 3:** [Mathematical expression describing rabbit population after year 3, including a, b, and x.]
4.  **Final Equation:** [Present the equation derived from the problem statement.]
5.  **Solve for a:** [Show the steps to determine the value of a.]
6.  **Solve for b:** [Show the steps to determine the value of b.]
7.  **Answer:** [Provide the final answer in the format: a = [value], b = [value]]

instruction: combine all of the descriptor prompts into a story
base_response:
Create a short story, approximately 300-500 words in length, that weaves together the following descriptive elements: "ornate," "primordial," "ethereal," "celestial," "gems," "embellished," "fractal," "jewelry," "encrusted," "cosmic," and "luxury." The story should focus on a goddess and her surroundings.

The narrative should begin with a description of the goddess and her appearance, emphasizing her connection to the celestial gems. Then, describe the realm in which she resides, highlighting the architectural details and interior design of the palaces and temples. Include a description of a specific scene or event that involves the goddess, the gems, and the haute couture dress that she might wear in that environment. Ensure the story evokes a sense of otherworldly splendor, elegance, and the goddess's inherent power and grace. Focus on vivid imagery and sensory details to bring the setting and characters to life.

original_prompt: What happens in the brain when I'm doing a fist with my hand?
instruction: What happens in the brain when I'm doing a fist with my hand?
base_response: Describe the neurological processes occurring in the brain when a person clenches their right hand into a fist. Include specific brain regions activated, neurotransmitters involved, and the sequence of events, from the initial motor planning in the prefrontal cortex to the execution of the fist-clenching action. Detail the role of the motor cortex, somatosensory cortex, cerebellum, and basal ganglia. The response should be formatted as a detailed, bulleted list suitable for a neuroscience student, and should not exceed 500 words.

original_prompt: What are the pros and cons of using modals in product design?
instruction: What are the pros and cons of using modals in product design?
base_response:
Analyze the use of modals in product design, specifically considering their impact on user experience (UX) and overall design effectiveness. For each identified pro and con, provide a concise explanation (1-2 sentences) and, where applicable, examples of scenarios where the point is particularly relevant. The response should be formatted as a bulleted list:

*   **Pros:**
    *   [Pro 1]: [Explanation and/or Example]
    *   [Pro 2]: [Explanation and/or Example]
    *   ...
*   **Cons:**
    *   [Con 1]: [Explanation and/or Example]
    *   [Con 2]: [Explanation and/or Example]
    *   ...

Limit the response to a maximum of 10 pros and 10 cons.

original_prompt: Although I'm not a professional, I am a self-taught coder and aspiring web developer going through The Odin Project. I find it quite difficult to optimize learning speed. When I try and set concrete goals, e.g. "complete this project by today", there's never any way of really knowing for sure if I'll be able to meet that goal, and I often don't. Do you have any advice for me?
instruction: Although I'm not a professional, I am a self-taught coder and aspiring web developer going through The Odin Project. I find it quite difficult to optimize learning speed. When I try and set concrete goals, e.g. "complete this project by today", there's never any way of really knowing for sure if I'll be able to meet that goal, and I often don't. Do you have any advice for me?
base_response:
You are an experienced career mentor specializing in software development. I am a self-taught coder and aspiring web developer currently working through The Odin Project curriculum. My goal is to maximize my learning speed and efficiency. I'm struggling with setting realistic, achievable goals. Specifically, I find it challenging to estimate the time required to complete projects and often fail to meet deadlines I set for myself (e.g., "complete X project by today").

Provide me with concrete, actionable advice on the following:

1.  **Goal Setting:** How can I effectively break down large projects into smaller, more manageable tasks with realistic time estimations?
2.  **Time Management:** What strategies and tools (e.g., time-tracking apps, Pomodoro technique) can I use to improve my focus and productivity during coding sessions?
3.  **Dealing with Setbacks:** How should I handle situations where I fall behind schedule or encounter unexpected challenges (e.g., debugging errors, complex concepts)?
4.  **Learning Resources:** Are there any specific resources (articles, videos, websites, etc.) you recommend that can further aid in my learning journey with The Odin Project?

Please structure your response in a concise, bulleted list format. Prioritize practical, easily implementable tips. Address each question separately.

Analyze the provided error logs to identify key technical terms, entities, and keywords. The error logs are:

Error 2 - host: mysql1.acme.com message: deadlock detected on table ORDERS, could not complete query

*   **Keywords:** Extract words or phrases that highlight the root cause or type of issue.

Second, using the first table as a basis, create a correlation matrix. The matrix should be a table format with the error numbers as both rows and columns. The cells of the matrix should contain estimated correlation values (a number between -1 and 1, where -1 is strong negative correlation, 0 is no correlation, and 1 is strong positive correlation) between each pair of errors.
