context:
"TEST REPORT P&T + Lube

Test Engineer / Responsible:	Business Unit	Test Center:	Completion Date:
Eng. D. Zaglia	Off Highway	Arco, Italy	June 7th, 2021


Requestor name:	Service Request ID:	Location:	Business Unit:
Mr. L. Fornoli	n.a.	Arco, Italy	Off Highway


Test Materials
Part Name:	Part Number:	Revision Level:	Model Series:	Samples N°:
755 Front Agri Axle	10145957	Proto 0	M2 21V CVT	1


Test Scope
According to the DVP&R of the M2 21V CVT project, It was requested a reduction of the power loss of the previous test 96_20 (std oil level) a new test was required for 755/10145957 MF Front Agri axle w/ reduced oil level (-0.5 lt.), Oil ELF SF3:
Power Loss vs. rpm up to 3234 rpm (53 kph) in @ 90, 60 °C, T amb. 25°C – FWD and REV (test diagrams file);
P&T: Power Loss & Temperature Raise @ 53 kph FWD;
Lube: different combinations of speed, direction, temperatures, 0°, monitoring oil levels in critical areas.
Ref. tests: 02_17 (755/611 M2), 05_17 (740/623 M2-19); 96_20 (755 M2-21 std oil level).

Summary of Results
Test completed w/o any issue, in particular no lubrication issues and no oil leak. Main results (96_20):
Power Loss vs. rpm @ 90°C 3.60 (4.55) kW, 60 °C 4.2 (5.7) kW, T amb. 8.1 (10.3) kW, after run-in; for other cond., see foll. Tab); In REV, Power Loss less than FWD.
P&T: @ 1 hr 6’ 85°C, 2.8 kW, then changing w/ Power Loss step and no stabilization, (ref. to 20°C amb.).; @ 2 hrs, about 110°C, 5.3 kW;
Lube: @ horizontal not any sign of lubrication problems (all P and T curves w/ normal behavior) oil levels in inclined not performed due to not suitable bench availability.
Final tear down: done after the following Hi-speed test  97_20.

	Test Result
	Partially PASSED: Improved but same Power Loss step


Conclusions 
The 755/10145957 “M2 21V CVT” axle did Partially passed the P&T + Lube test due to:
P&T test: Temperature in central remained below 120°C (max. allowable) within target 2 hrs, but curves become not regular behavior (P. Loss step up) after 1hr:6’ w/ no stabilization;
Power Loss values significantly lower than reference test w/ M2 axle and also of 740 axle (ref. 05_17);
Lubrication: oil level always above min. oil level in all compartments.
Advised to not reduce further oil level unless the Power Loss step-up is solved.
Others: no oil leak and not any lubrication problem.

Test start: April 7th, 2021; April 8th, 2021.

Main data axle
BOM 755/10145957 Axle s/n s/n C-ITA-374922 Proto1, assembled originally @ Como and reassembled @ Arco after tests 96_21 P&T and 97_21 Hi-speed, installed @ Test Lab w/ transparent oil tubes for oil level monitoring (both arms, between pinion bearings, between pinion tail baring and seal; axle Total Reduction Ratio: Bevel set: 14/37 LH Crown input pinion n. -, Hub reduction ratio i hr = 6.353, 4 planetary gears ground std prod. i tot. = 16.79.
Seals, all by FST: Arm: New Combi-Go p/n 10118272; other seals from std prod: input p/n 760.04.012.01, sun gear cassette seal p/n 10152216, wheel hub kassette seal p/n 755.06.082.01.
Oil: Total Tractelf SF3 (UTTO, DANA first fill), central 11.0 -0.5 lt. (below @ oil level), Final Drives 1.9 lt. each. Oil quantities referred to first fill @ Como (from APR).
Test bench: Brakes2. Operator: Giuseppe F.
Calibration data, ref file: PRSSTS015011#001BF2.xlsx – updated?
 
Test Procedure/Description
Same of 96_20: spinning at speed with of 53 km/h, Horizontal, FWD direction only, Wheel Radius = 0.73 m, equivalent to an input rpm in = 3234 rpm, no torque/load, no steer. 
Others: Axle in horizontal position; No ventilation.
Temperature probe on central housing (oil drain plug). 

Parameters to be Measured / Monitored
Measured parameters: input speed, differential (drain oil plug) and ambient temperature. 
Test cycle
Speed from max. (3234 rpm @ pinion) to 0 rpm at the following temperature values (tolerance ±5 °C):
25° C (T ambient)
60° C
90° C 
Air ventilation if necessary with cooling fans to adjust to the desired temperature.

Acceptance Criteria
According to std. DANA Reference TS.30.P&T.A: max. 120°C oil (ref. 120°C; not if stabilized.
Lubrication: oi level must not be lower the lower roller axis, so to have all bearings receive sufficient lubricant amount.
Others: No failure of any components, no leak (acc. to TS: max. level 2 acceptable to SAE J1176), no sign of overheat/seizure on bearings.

Results
(For other data/details, see diagrams in appendix and file: “159_19 730-10134295 design validation.doc”)
Power Loss and P&T Test: Following development steps had been done without ventilation. Oil @ lev. -0.5 lt. (data 90_20).

	Dir.	T cent. [°C]	P [kW]	T cent. [°C]	Time test	P [kW]	
3234	FWD	25	8.1 (9.4)	-	-	-	at 0 hrs, before P&T test
3234	FWD	-	-	110	120	5.3	85°C / 2.8 kW @ 60’, then Power step-up;  not stabilization (25° amb.)
3234	FWD	90	3.6 (4.5)	-	-	-	After run-in
“	FWD	60	5.2 (5.7)	-	-	-

instruction:
5 / 5Given this Test Report, please extract all relevant measures for test scope and  summary of results specifying a proper label, the value and the unit of measure in a table.
Add a summary of test result and conclusions at the end:
base_response:
Analyze the provided "TEST REPORT P&T + Lube" document. Extract all relevant measurements related to the test scope and summarize the results in a table format. Include the following information for each measurement: a descriptive label, the value, and the unit of measure. Specifically, look for measurements related to:

*   Power loss at different temperatures and speeds (rpm or kph).
*   Temperature raise during the P&T test.
*   Oil levels and any lubrication-related observations.
*   Any other key parameters or observations related to the test, including run-in results.

The table should have the following columns: "Measurement", "Value", "Unit", "Condition/Remarks".

After creating the table, summarize the test results, including a final conclusion about whether the test was passed or failed and the main reasons for the outcome. Also, include any recommendations from the report.

original_prompt: While trying to understand what could have triggered an incident at Customer Support Centre, a GB creates a ___________ because frequently it is 20% of the problems could have resulted in 80% of incidents
instruction: While trying to understand what could have triggered an incident at Customer Support Centre, a GB creates a ___________ because frequently it is 20% of the problems could have resulted in 80% of incidents
base_response:
While investigating the root cause of recent incidents at the Customer Support Centre, a GB (Green Belt) is creating a document to identify the most impactful issues. The GB wants to apply the Pareto principle (80/20 rule) to prioritize these issues, recognizing that approximately 20% of the underlying problems likely contribute to 80% of the reported incidents.

**Write a title and a concise, bullet-pointed list summarizing the key findings of the GB's analysis. Each bullet point should represent a potential root cause or issue. The analysis should specifically consider:**

*   **Data Source:** Incident reports and support tickets from the last [Specify Time Period, e.g., 3 months, 6 months].
*   **Metric for Prioritization:** Number of incidents triggered by each issue.
*   **Desired Output Format:**
    *   **Title:** Pareto Analysis of Customer Support Incidents
    *   **List:** Bulleted list format
    *   **Each bullet point should include:**
        *   The issue/root cause in a concise phrase
        *   The percentage of total incidents the issue represents (rounded to the nearest whole number)
        *   (Optional) A brief comment if an issue is particularly impactful or needs immediate action.

The GB expects the analysis to reveal the key drivers of the support centre's problems, enabling the identification of high-impact areas for improvement.

original_prompt: Write a Javascript function that returns the date and time for a given start date T0, an array of timesteps in seconds since T0 and the index number for that array.
instruction: Write a Javascript function that returns the date and time for a given start date T0, an array of timesteps in seconds since T0 and the index number for that array.
base_response:
```
Write a well-documented JavaScript function named `getDateAndTime` that accepts three arguments: 
1.  `T0`: A JavaScript Date object representing the starting date and time (e.g., new Date()).
2.  `timeSteps`: An array of numbers, where each number represents a time step in seconds since `T0`.
3.  `index`: A number representing the index of the `timeSteps` array.

The function should calculate the date and time corresponding to the specified `index` within the `timeSteps` array, adding the appropriate number of seconds to `T0`. The function should return a JavaScript Date object representing the calculated date and time.

Constraints:

*   Handle potential errors gracefully (e.g., invalid `index` values, non-numeric values in `timeSteps`). Consider returning `null` or throwing an error with a descriptive message if an error occurs.
*   Ensure the function is efficient and avoids unnecessary computations.
*   Provide clear comments explaining the logic within the function.

Example Usage:

```javascript
const T0 = new Date(2024, 0, 1, 10, 0, 0); // January 1, 2024 10:00:00 AM
const timeSteps = [60, 120, 180, 300];
const index = 2;
const result = getDateAndTime(T0, timeSteps, index);
console.log(result); // Expected output: a Date object representing January 1, 2024 10:03:00 AM (T0 + 180 seconds)
```
```

original_prompt: Write a prompt describing your portrait for another AI program to draw. You should give specific details about your face and emotions.
instruction: Write a prompt describing your portrait for another AI program to draw. You should give specific details about your face and emotions.
base_response:
Create a detailed text description for an AI image generator to create a portrait of my face. Include the following specific details:

*   **Facial Features:** Describe the shape of my face (e.g., oval, round, square), eye color, hair color and style, nose shape, mouth shape, and any distinguishing features like moles, scars, or wrinkles. Be as descriptive as possible.
*   **Emotion:** Clearly indicate the primary emotion I should be displaying (e.g., joy, sadness, anger, contemplation). Describe how this emotion manifests in my facial expressions (e.g., upturned lips, furrowed brow, widened eyes).
*   **Pose:** Describe the pose. Should the head be tilted or straight? Where should the eyes be looking?
*   **Lighting:** Specify the type of lighting (e.g., soft, dramatic, natural, studio) and the direction of the light.
*   **Style:** Suggest an artistic style (e.g., photorealistic, watercolor, oil painting, cartoon).
*   **Background:** Briefly describe the background (e.g., plain color, specific environment, blurred).
*   **Overall Impression:** Summarize the overall impression the portrait should convey.

This prompt should be detailed enough to guide the AI in generating a visually accurate and emotionally evocative portrait.

original_prompt: How would you translate to english, and explain, the swedish word ”halvhalt”?
instruction: How would you translate to english, and explain, the swedish word ”halvhalt”?
base_response: Translate the Swedish word "halvhalt" to English and explain its meaning in the context of equestrianism (horse riding), including its purpose and how it's executed. Provide the translation, a concise definition, and a more detailed explanation that breaks down the technique, its benefits, and common mistakes to avoid. The response should be formatted with the following sections: "Translation:", "Definition:", "Explanation:". Use clear and accessible language, assuming a reader with some basic knowledge of horse riding.

original_prompt: suggest movies similar to once (the irish movie)
instruction: suggest movies similar to once (the irish movie)
base_response: Recommend five movies similar to the Irish musical drama "Once" (2007), considering these aspects: a focus on music, romance, and independent filmmaking. For each recommendation, include the movie title, year of release, a brief (one-sentence) description highlighting its musical and romantic elements, and the primary reason for the similarity to "Once". Present the suggestions in a numbered list format.

original_prompt: Can you give me feedback on my text?
instruction: Can you give me feedback on my text?
base_response: Please provide the text you would like me to review. I will provide feedback on clarity, grammar, and overall effectiveness. Specify the target audience for the text (e.g., general public, experts in a specific field). Indicate the purpose of the text (e.g., to inform, persuade, entertain). Please also specify the desired tone (e.g., formal, informal, humorous). Finally, state your preferred feedback format (e.g., bullet points, a paragraph, edits within the text).

original_prompt:
generate 5W1H:


The final three episodes of Prince Harry and his wife Meghan's Netflix documentary series air on Thursday (Dec 15), with more criticism expected to be directed at the British royals just as King Charles and his family gather for a Christmas carol service.

In the first tranche of episodes released last week, Harry and Meghan again launched fierce attacks on the media over their treatment, some of which they said had been racist, but the royals themselves escaped relatively unscathed.

Trailers for the final shows indicate some more damning commentary on the Windsors, however, with Harry referring to "institutional gaslighting", and saying unspecified people had been "happy to lie to protect my brother", Prince William, who is now heir to the throne.

"They were never willing to tell the truth to protect us," Harry says.


Meghan's lawyer, Jenny Afia, and a friend were both shown in another trailer, saying how Buckingham Palace had briefed negative stories to the press about the couple to avoid unfavourable stories about other royals being printed.

"There was a real kind of war against Meghan," Afia said. Meanwhile newspapers have described the documentary series as the couple's war on the royals.

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, as Harry and Meghan are officially known, stepped down from royal duties in March 2020, saying they wanted to forge new lives in the United States away from media harassment, which the couple said had threatened to destroy their mental health.

"I wonder what would have happened to us had we not got out when we did," Harry says in a trailer. "I said 'we need to get out of here'," he adds, describing their exit as the "freedom flight".

HOSTILE PRESS

While the couple have won awards and plaudits from some across the Atlantic for their charitable and human rights work, back in Britain a hostile press accuses them of seeking to make millions from their royal status while constantly attacking the monarchy.

Newspapers have also cited former unnamed royal aides challenging the couple's narrative in the documentaries, saying there were inaccuracies in their accounts.

Both Buckingham Palace and William's office, Kensington Palace, have said they would not be commenting on the documentaries.

A royal source also said neither the palace nor representatives of William or other royals had been approached for comment for the series itself, contradicting a Netflix statement that said they had declined to comment.

According to initial figures cited by the BBC, some 2.4 million viewers in Britain watched the first episode on the day it was released, although the senior royals themselves have steered clear, royal sources have told newspapers.

Hours after the final three episodes are made available at 8am in Britain, Charles, his wife Camilla, Prince William and his wife Kate along with other royals will attend a carol service at London's Westminster Abbey to "recognise the selfless efforts of individuals, families and communities across the UK".

The service will also be dedicated to the late Queen Elizabeth, whose funeral was held in the Abbey in September.
context:
The final three episodes of Prince Harry and his wife Meghan's Netflix documentary series air on Thursday (Dec 15), with more criticism expected to be directed at the British royals just as King Charles and his family gather for a Christmas carol service.

In the first tranche of episodes released last week, Harry and Meghan again launched fierce attacks on the media over their treatment, some of which they said had been racist, but the royals themselves escaped relatively unscathed.

Trailers for the final shows indicate some more damning commentary on the Windsors, however, with Harry referring to "institutional gaslighting", and saying unspecified people had been "happy to lie to protect my brother", Prince William, who is now heir to the throne.

"They were never willing to tell the truth to protect us," Harry says.


Meghan's lawyer, Jenny Afia, and a friend were both shown in another trailer, saying how Buckingham Palace had briefed negative stories to the press about the couple to avoid unfavourable stories about other royals being printed.

"There was a real kind of war against Meghan," Afia said. Meanwhile newspapers have described the documentary series as the couple's war on the royals.

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex, as Harry and Meghan are officially known, stepped down from royal duties in March 2020, saying they wanted to forge new lives in the United States away from media harassment, which the couple said had threatened to destroy their mental health.

"I wonder what would have happened to us had we not got out when we did," Harry says in a trailer. "I said 'we need to get out of here'," he adds, describing their exit as the "freedom flight".

HOSTILE PRESS

While the couple have won awards and plaudits from some across the Atlantic for their charitable and human rights work, back in Britain a hostile press accuses them of seeking to make millions from their royal status while constantly attacking the monarchy.

Newspapers have also cited former unnamed royal aides challenging the couple's narrative in the documentaries, saying there were inaccuracies in their accounts.

Both Buckingham Palace and William's office, Kensington Palace, have said they would not be commenting on the documentaries.

A royal source also said neither the palace nor representatives of William or other royals had been approached for comment for the series itself, contradicting a Netflix statement that said they had declined to comment.

According to initial figures cited by the BBC, some 2.4 million viewers in Britain watched the first episode on the day it was released, although the senior royals themselves have steered clear, royal sources have told newspapers.

Hours after the final three episodes are made available at 8am in Britain, Charles, his wife Camilla, Prince William and his wife Kate along with other royals will attend a carol service at London's Westminster Abbey to "recognise the selfless efforts of individuals, families and communities across the UK".

The service will also be dedicated to the late Queen Elizabeth, whose funeral was held in the Abbey in September.

base_response:

The final output should be the table.

original_prompt: create an argumentation between a person that believes the earth is flat and a scientist who knows the earth is a geoid.
instruction: create an argumentation between a person that believes the earth is flat and a scientist who knows the earth is a geoid.
base_response: Write a dialogue script between two characters: "Flat Earther Frank" and "Scientist Sarah." Flat Earther Frank firmly believes the Earth is a flat disc, while Scientist Sarah, a geophysicist, knows the Earth is a geoid. The scene takes place in a public park. The dialogue should cover at least five distinct arguments presented by Frank to support his flat-Earth belief (e.g., the horizon, the sun's movement) and Sarah's counter-arguments based on scientific principles and evidence (e.g., gravity, satellite imagery, circumnavigation). Sarah's responses must be detailed, explaining the scientific concepts in a way a layperson could understand. The script should be approximately 500-600 words long and formatted as a play, with character names followed by their lines.

original_prompt: Write a computer program that finds S and G from a given training set.
instruction: Write a computer program that finds S and G from a given training set.
base_response: Write a Python program that implements the algorithm described in the paper "Name of the paper" (if applicable, otherwise remove the paper name). The program should take a training set as input, where the training set is a list of examples. Each example consists of a set of attributes and a binary classification label (True or False). The program should output the Specificity (S) and Generality (G) hypotheses derived from the training set using the Find-S algorithm (or the specific algorithm used in the paper). The output should be formatted as a dictionary, with keys "S" and "G", where the values for "S" and "G" are lists, representing the attribute values for the respective hypotheses.  If no consistent hypotheses can be found, print an informative error message instead. Clearly comment the code explaining each step and the logic behind it. Provide example input data and expected output for testing, including edge cases.

original_prompt: in Dynamics 365 ce I need to translate the products via a plugin, write me a C# plugin
instruction: in Dynamics 365 ce I need to translate the products via a plugin, write me a C# plugin
base_response:
Develop a C# plugin for Dynamics 365 CE (Customer Engagement) that translates product names and descriptions into multiple languages. The plugin should:

1.  **Trigger:** Execute on the `Create` and `Update` messages of the `product` entity.
2.  **Language Detection:** Implement logic to determine the original language of the product name and description (e.g., using a language detection library like `Microsoft.Azure.CognitiveServices.Language.TextAnalytics`).
3.  **Translation:** Utilize the Microsoft Translator API (or a similar translation service) to translate the product name and description into at least three specified target languages (e.g., French, Spanish, German). Include error handling for translation failures.
4.  **Data Storage:** Store the translated product names and descriptions as notes attached to the product record, clearly indicating the language of each translation.
5.  **Configuration:** Allow configurable settings for the target languages and API keys. Consider using settings stored in the Dynamics 365 settings table.
6.  **Error Logging:** Implement robust error logging to the Dynamics 365 audit log or custom entity.

Provide the complete C# plugin code, including namespaces, necessary references, and comments explaining the logic. Include a sample configuration setup instruction. Document the steps to register the plugin in Dynamics 365 CE, including steps for configuring the triggering events and settings.

Please provide a detailed list of all the information you would require to perform this appraisal. original_prompt: Write a job listing for a product designer who is good at user research and conducting user interviews, owning product problems end-to-end and distilling designing challenges to product decisions. Don't be too sales-y
instruction: Write a job listing for a product designer who is good at user research and conducting user interviews, owning product problems end-to-end and distilling designing challenges to product decisions. Don't be too sales-y
base_response:
**Prompt:**

Craft a job listing for a Product Designer with a focus on user research and product ownership, suitable for a [Company Name] (a [brief description of company and industry]). The ideal candidate excels at:

*   **User Research:** Planning, conducting, and synthesizing user research, including user interviews, usability testing, and surveys.
*   **Product Ownership:** Owning product problems from start to finish, including problem definition, ideation, prototyping, testing, and iteration.
*   **Design Thinking:** Transforming design challenges into actionable product decisions.

The job listing should highlight:

*   The importance of user-centered design.
*   Responsibilities like collaborating with engineers, product managers, and stakeholders.
*   Experience with [Mention specific design tools or platforms, e.g., Figma, Sketch, Miro].
*   A clear call to action (e.g., "Apply Now").
*   A salary range of [Specify salary range or "competitive"].
*   Avoid overly promotional language and focus on the day-to-day responsibilities and the impact the designer will have.
*   The listing should be no longer than 300 words.

Format: Use a clear and concise bulleted list for responsibilities and qualifications. Include a brief "About [Company Name]" section at the beginning or end.

original_prompt:
Please write a reply to this email, saying thanks for the information and that I'm interested in knowing more about it:
###
Dear Andre,

I hope this email finds you well.

Today, I want to discuss the importance of web accessibility for your website.
With over a billion people worldwide living with disabilities, it's crucial that we create websites that are easy to use for everyone.

Web accessibility means designing and developing websites that can be used by people with disabilities,
such as those who are blind, deaf, or have limited mobility.

This involves creating content that can be easily accessed using assistive technologies, such as screen readers or keyboard-only navigation.

There are several benefits to creating an accessible website.
For one, it ensures that your website is inclusive and reaches the broadest possible audience.

It also helps you comply with accessibility laws and regulations, such as the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA),
which requires businesses to provide equal access to their goods and services.

Additionally, an accessible website can improve the user experience for all users, not just those with disabilities.

It can make your website more user-friendly, faster to navigate, and easier to use across different devices and platforms.

In this email series, we'll cover the basics of web accessibility and how it can benefit your website and your users.

I hope that you find this information helpful and informative.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or concerns.

Free trial

Best regards,
Jacob

instruction:
I am creating a checklist for an executive recruiting agency to search for a CEO for my mid-stage series B cybersecurity SaaS startup. 

We are a breach and attack simulation company that helps large and medium enterprises test if their security controls are working during a real-world attack. 

There is a learning that this problem cannot be solved for our users by a saas software alone. Professional services must augment it.



Please craft a ten-item checklist using the information above and anything I might be missing with the most important item before the less important thing.
base_response:
Develop a ten-item checklist for an executive recruiting agency to use when searching for a CEO for a mid-stage Series B cybersecurity SaaS startup. The startup specializes in breach and attack simulation, helping large and medium enterprises test their security controls. A key consideration is that the business model necessitates professional services to augment the SaaS offering.

The checklist should prioritize essential qualifications and desired traits, ranking them from most to least important. Include the following criteria, expanding on each as necessary for clarity and thoroughness:

1.  **Deep understanding of security products and services:**
    *   Experience with companies like Optiv, Deloitte, EY, or similar organizations.
    *   Demonstrated ability to create and sell products and services related to penetration testing, security operations centers (SOCs), threat intelligence, and detection engineering.
    *   Proven ability to hire and retain senior leaders capable of managing highly skilled technical staff.
    *   Successful leadership of go-to-market (GTM) strategies and product positioning for large and upper-mid-market enterprises.

2.  **Proven ability to raise capital:**
    *   Experience as a managing partner of a private equity firm or investment fund.
    *   Successful completion of multiple capital-raising rounds.

3.  **Track record of leading a company through high-growth stages:**
    *   Ideally, experience within the cybersecurity or SaaS space.
    *   Evidence of scaling a company through significant revenue and user growth.

4.  **High level of customer engagement:**
    *   Actively engages with customers to understand their needs and pain points.
    *   Demonstrated understanding and utilization of the company's products and services.
    *   Ability to react quickly to market changes and customer feedback.
    *   Proven ability to motivate and inspire employees.

5.  **Demonstrates integrity and ethical leadership:**
    *   A history of making ethical decisions.
    *   Transparent and inclusive approach to decision-making.

6.  **[Add at least 4 additional checklist items that are implied or not explicitly mentioned in the prompt but are critical for a CEO of a cybersecurity SaaS startup.]**
7.  **[ ]**
8.  **[ ]**
9.  **[ ]**
10. **[ ]**

Format the output as a numbered list (1-10) with each item clearly and concisely stated.

original_prompt: can you tell an epic adventure about a boy named giovanni who one day decided to not wear his biking helmet, found a hill by his middle school, rode down the hill and when he hit the bottom a bump sent him flying over the handlebars of his bike where he came crashing down and cracked his skull.
instruction: can you tell an epic adventure about a boy named giovanni who one day decided to not wear his biking helmet, found a hill by his middle school, rode down the hill and when he hit the bottom a bump sent him flying over the handlebars of his bike where he came crashing down and cracked his skull.
base_response:
Compose a compelling and suspenseful epic adventure story about a young boy named Giovanni. The story should begin with Giovanni, a middle school student, making the fateful decision to forgo wearing his biking helmet one sunny afternoon. He's riding his bicycle after school.

The narrative should then shift to describe his discovery of a particularly steep and challenging hill near his middle school. Detail the thrill and excitement he feels as he begins to ride down the hill at increasing speed, focusing on sensory details and the escalating sense of danger.

Next, chronicle the dramatic moment when Giovanni, moving too fast, hits a hidden bump near the bottom of the hill. This should propel him over the handlebars of his bike.

Then, describe the impact as he crashes to the ground, focusing on the physical sensation of the fall and the immediate consequences of his head hitting the ground (cracked skull).

Following the accident, transition the story into a survival epic: Giovanni is now alone and critically injured, he needs to find a way to call for help before it's too late. Detail his struggles, his thoughts, and the obstacles he faces.

Consider the following elements to enhance the story:

*   **Setting:** Specify the time of year and any relevant geographical details about the hill and its surroundings.
*   **Character Development:** Give Giovanni unique characteristics, personality traits, or internal conflicts that add depth to the narrative.
*   **Tension:** build suspense before the fall.
*   **Emotional Impact:** Make the reader empathize with Giovanni.
*   **Word Count:** Aim for a story between 500 and 800 words.

original_prompt: What's the Difference between CTO and CIO?
instruction: What's the Difference between CTO and CIO?
base_response:
Compare and contrast the roles of a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and a Chief Information Officer (CIO) within a technology-driven organization. Your response should include:

*   **Responsibilities:** Detail the primary responsibilities and typical duties of each role.
*   **Focus:** Highlight the key areas of focus for each role (e.g., technology strategy, operational efficiency).
*   **Reporting Structure:** Explain who each role typically reports to within the organizational hierarchy.
*   **Skills & Experience:** Outline the necessary skills and experience commonly associated with each role.
*   **Interaction/Collaboration:** Describe how the CTO and CIO roles typically interact and collaborate.

Present the information in a well-organized table format with the following columns: Role, Responsibilities, Focus, Reporting Structure, Skills & Experience, and Interaction/Collaboration.

original_prompt: act as an expert android architecture developer
instruction: act as an expert android architecture developer
base_response:
You are an experienced Android Architecture Developer. You will provide detailed, best-practice architectural recommendations for developing Android applications.

I want you to analyze the following scenario: [Insert specific scenario: e.g., a new social media application, a mobile banking app, etc.].

Consider the following aspects in your analysis:

*   **Application Type:** [Specify the type of application: e.g., e-commerce, game, utility app, etc.]
*   **Key Features:** [List 3-5 key features of the application.]
*   **Scalability Requirements:** [Describe the expected user base and growth.]
*   **Performance Goals:** [Specify performance goals, such as fast loading times, smooth animations, etc.]
*   **Team Skillset:** [Assume a team with X years of Android development experience.]

Your response should include the following sections:

1.  **Proposed Architecture:** Describe the recommended architectural pattern (e.g., MVVM, MVI, Clean Architecture) and explain why it's suitable for the given scenario, considering the application's specific requirements.
2.  **Technical Stack:** Recommend specific libraries and tools for key aspects like:
    *   Data Management (e.g., Room, DataStore, Network layer)
    *   UI Development (e.g., Jetpack Compose, XML, ViewBinding)
    *   Dependency Injection (e.g., Hilt, Koin)
    *   Navigation (e.g., Jetpack Navigation, Compose Navigation)
    *   Testing (e.g., JUnit, Espresso, Compose testing)
3.  **Code Example (Illustrative):** Provide a concise code snippet (Kotlin preferred) demonstrating the implementation of a crucial component within the chosen architecture (e.g., a ViewModel, a data repository).
4.  **Advantages and Disadvantages:** Briefly discuss the pros and cons of your chosen architecture and technical choices, considering trade-offs.
5.  **Scalability Considerations:** Discuss how the proposed architecture facilitates future scaling and growth of the application.
6.  **Maintainability and Testability:** Explain how the chosen architecture promotes maintainability and testability of the code.

Format your response clearly, with each section clearly labeled. Use markdown formatting for readability (e.g., bullet points, code blocks).

original_prompt: I want to create chat like on Dating site usong symfony. Create Entity and postgress migrations
instruction: I want to create chat like on Dating site usong symfony. Create Entity and postgress migrations
base_response:
Develop a Symfony-based chat functionality, mirroring the style of a dating website.

**Specific Requirements:**

1.  **Entities:** Design and implement database entities to store chat-related data. Consider:
    *   `Chat`: Represents a chat conversation (e.g., unique identifier, creation timestamp, participants).
    *   `ChatMessage`: Stores individual messages within a chat (e.g., chat identifier, sender, message content, timestamp).
    *   `User`:  Assume a pre-existing User entity; link the chat to user profiles. Modify if necessary.
2.  **Database:** Use PostgreSQL for database storage.
3.  **Migrations:** Generate Symfony database migrations for the created entities, ensuring proper schema creation and version control.
4.  **Relationships:** Define and implement the necessary relationships between entities (e.g., OneToMany/ManyToOne between `Chat` and `ChatMessage`, ManyToMany between `Chat` and `User` or other appropriate relationship).
5.  **Constraints:** Define appropriate database constraints (e.g., not-null constraints, unique constraints, foreign key constraints) to ensure data integrity.

**Output Format:**

1.  Provide the following for each entity:
    *   Symfony entity class code (PHP).
    *   PostgreSQL migration file (PHP).
    *   Brief comments explaining the purpose of each field and relationship.
2.  Present the code in a clear, readable format, suitable for direct implementation within a Symfony project.

**Constraints:**

*   Focus on the core database structure and migrations, excluding UI/UX or real-time chat implementation.
*   Assume a simplified user authentication system is already in place. Focus on chat-specific data modeling.
*   Assume standard Symfony project setup (e.g., Doctrine ORM is available and configured).
*   Ensure compatibility with the latest stable versions of Symfony and Doctrine ORM.

5. Experiment with different thumbnails. This can help increase your ranking in a given search, which will ultimately boost your CTR.[3]:To calculate CTR, use the formula CTR = number of clicks / total impressions x 100.YouTube also has two different CTR metrics, Video CTR, and Channel CTR. Video CTR is the number of clicks on a specific video divided by the number of times the video was shown. Channel CTR is the number of clicks on all of the videos on a channel divided by the number of times all the videos on that channel were shown.Some other strategies to increase YouTube CTR include:Having a catchy, attention-grabbing titleUsing keywords in your title and description to help your video show up in search resultsLeveraging playlists and end screens to increase the visibility and watch time of your videosOptimizing your video's metadata, including titles, descriptions, and tagsEncourage viewers to like and share your videosUse annotations, cards, and other interactive elements to encourage engagement and drive clicks to your website or other videos.It is worth mentioning that boosting CTR is not the only metric you should focus on, other metric should be considered like retention rate, bounce rate, watch time, engagement, etc. Creating a good video that people will want to watch is important for the success of the video, but also the audience will be more likely to share, comment, or subscribe to the channel.Web search results:

original_prompt: Will Microsoft add chatGPT to its search engine in the future
instruction: Will Microsoft add chatGPT to its search engine in the future
base_response:
Develop a detailed and reasoned analysis forecasting the likelihood of Microsoft integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT (or a similar large language model) into its Bing search engine within the next 12-18 months. Consider factors such as:

*   Microsoft's existing partnership with OpenAI.
*   The competitive landscape of search engines (Google, etc.).
*   Technological feasibility and potential challenges of such integration (scalability, cost, user experience).
*   Potential impact on user search behavior and market share.
*   Microsoft's strategic goals in the search engine market.
*   Risks and rewards of such a move.

Your response should be formatted as a comprehensive report and include the following sections:

1.  **Executive Summary:** Briefly summarize the predicted outcome.
2.  **Background:** Briefly discuss Microsoft's and OpenAI's relationship and the current state of search.
3.  **Likelihood Assessment:** Detail the factors influencing the probability of integration, including a specific percentage likelihood estimate, and provide a rationale for your assessment.
4.  **Potential Benefits:** Outline the advantages of integrating ChatGPT (or a similar LLM) into Bing.
5.  **Potential Challenges:** Detail the potential drawbacks and obstacles.
6.  **Conclusion:** Summarize the overall assessment and provide final recommendations.

original_prompt: write a python code for detecting car types using drone top view pictures.
instruction: write a python code for detecting car types using drone top view pictures.
base_response:
Develop a Python script using TensorFlow or PyTorch to detect car types (e.g., sedan, SUV, truck) from drone-captured, top-down view images. The script should:

1.  Load a pre-trained Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model (e.g., YOLO, SSD, or a custom model trained on a relevant dataset) capable of object detection and classification. Specify the chosen model architecture.
2.  Implement image preprocessing steps, including resizing and normalization, suitable for the selected CNN model. Specify the expected input image dimensions.
3.  Define a list of at least 5 distinct car types to be detected.
4.  Include a function to load and process a single drone image as input.
5.  Implement the object detection logic, identifying and classifying cars within the input image.
6.  Draw bounding boxes around the detected cars, labeling each box with the car type and confidence score.
7.  Output:
    *   The processed image with bounding boxes overlaid.
    *   A list of detected cars, their types, and confidence scores in a JSON format. Example: `[{"car_type": "sedan", "confidence": 0.85, "bounding_box": [x1, y1, x2, y2]}, {"car_type": "SUV", "confidence": 0.70, "bounding_box": [x3, y3, x4, y4]}]`.
8.  Provide clear comments throughout the code explaining each step.
9.  Assume drone images are in JPEG format and available in a specified directory.
10. Include error handling for invalid image paths or model loading failures.

original_prompt:
I would like to ask you a comprehensive research on "The Future of Banking in Metaverse" designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of the relationship between the Metaverse and banking. The book should specifically cover the impact of the metaverse on banking, the use of the metaverse in various areas of banking, and future prospects. This book should be written from the perspective of a financial professional and is intended for banking professionals, financial experts and anyone interested in understanding the impact of the metaverse on the financial world.
This book is two hundred A5 pages. Please make a table of contents for this book in eight chapters and ten sections in each chapter. Make an explanatory paragraph for each chapter.
instruction:
I would like to ask you a comprehensive research on "The Future of Banking in Metaverse" designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of the relationship between the Metaverse and banking. The book should specifically cover the impact of the metaverse on banking, the use of the metaverse in various areas of banking, and future prospects. This book should be written from the perspective of a financial professional and is intended for banking professionals, financial experts and anyone interested in understanding the impact of the metaverse on the financial world.
This book is two hundred A5 pages. Please make a table of contents for this book in eight chapters and ten sections in each chapter. Make an explanatory paragraph for each chapter.
base_response:
You are a financial expert tasked with creating a comprehensive book titled "The Future of Banking in the Metaverse." This book, targeted towards banking professionals, financial experts, and individuals interested in the intersection of the metaverse and finance, should provide a detailed analysis of the topic.

**Book Specifications:**

*   **Length:** 200 A5-sized pages.
*   **Perspective:** Written from the viewpoint of a seasoned financial professional.
*   **Focus:** Explore the impact of the metaverse on banking, its practical applications within various banking areas, and future prospects.

**Output Requirements:**

Create a detailed Table of Contents (TOC) for the book. The TOC should be structured as follows:

*   **Number of Chapters:** 8
*   **Sections per Chapter:** 10
*   **Content:**
    *   Each chapter in the TOC must have a concise, descriptive title reflecting the key theme.
    *   Following each chapter title, provide a short (approximately 3-4 sentence) explanatory paragraph summarizing the chapter's content and purpose. The paragraph should highlight the chapter's key themes, target audience relevance, and overall contribution to understanding the future of banking in the Metaverse.
    *   Each section title within the chapters should accurately reflect the specific topics covered.

The TOC should be formatted in a clear and easily readable structure that will enable a reader to understand the scope and structure of the book.

original_prompt: can you give me an example of two words that is not anagrams but have the same amount of letters and have the same charcode sum?
instruction: can you give me an example of two words that is not anagrams but have the same amount of letters and have the same charcode sum?
base_response: Craft a Python script to identify two English words that meet the following criteria: (1) They are not anagrams of each other; (2) They consist of the same number of letters; (3) The sum of the ASCII character codes for each word is identical. The script should: (a) Define a function `charcode_sum(word)` that calculates the sum of the ASCII values of a given word's characters; (b) Load a standard English dictionary (e.g., from a text file or a Python library like `nltk`). (c) Iterate through the dictionary, comparing words for the specified characteristics. (d) Output a list of tuples, where each tuple contains two words meeting the criteria. Limit the dictionary search to words with a length between 5 and 8 letters, and generate a maximum of 3 examples. Provide the full Python code.

original_prompt: Write me a long conversations between a Latin American Products seller who lives in Canada (the student) and a buyer (the teacher) include many descriptions of the products the seller offers. Use a plenty of adjectives to describe the products of your catalogue: fruit pulp frozen, cassava frozen, dried beans, panela, mixes, pantry, sauces, peppers, chipotle peppers, food service size. Talk about delivery and products in stock.
context: Use a plenty of adjectives to describe the products of your catalogue: fruit pulp frozen, cassava frozen, dried beans, panela, mixes, pantry, sauces, peppers, chipotle peppers, food service size.
instruction: Write me a long conversations between a Latin American Products seller who lives in Canada (the student) and a buyer (the teacher) include many descriptions of the products the seller offers.  Talk about delivery and products in stock.
base_response:
**Improved Prompt:**

Compose a detailed and engaging conversation, approximately 500-700 words, between a Latin American product seller (a student) based in Toronto, Canada, and a potential buyer (a teacher) looking to stock their classroom's cultural food pantry. The conversation should highlight the student's product offerings and address potential buyer concerns.

The student should enthusiastically describe a variety of products from their catalogue, including:

*   **Frozen Fruit Pulp:** Offer descriptions of mango, guava, passion fruit, and tamarind pulp, using vivid adjectives to emphasize their flavors (e.g., "tangy," "sweet," "tropical," "intense").
*   **Frozen Cassava:** Detail the preparation suggestions and textural properties of the frozen cassava (e.g., "perfect for frying," "creamy after boiling").
*   **Dried Beans:** Describe different types of dried beans available, focusing on cooking instructions and taste profiles (e.g., "pinto beans, excellent for stews and soups").
*   **Panela:** Explain what panela is, how it's used, and highlight its unique flavor compared to refined sugar (e.g., "unrefined cane sugar," "caramel-like undertones").
*   **Mixes:** Include descriptions of pre-made mixes for arepas, empanadas, or other popular Latin American foods, emphasizing ease of use and authentic flavors.
*   **Pantry Staples:** List other essential pantry items, like specific types of rice, flours, and spices.
*   **Sauces and Peppers:** Showcase a selection of Latin American sauces, including their heat levels and flavor profiles. Offer descriptions of chipotle peppers (e.g., smoky, savory) and other peppers.
*   **Food Service Size Options:** Clarify the availability of food service sizes for certain products.

The teacher should ask questions about:

*   Product origins and authenticity.
*   Delivery options and costs within the Greater Toronto Area.
*   Minimum order quantities.
*   Products currently in stock and potential lead times for out-of-stock items.
*   Storage recommendations for frozen and non-frozen products.
*   Allergy information.

The student should answer all questions comprehensively and professionally, aiming to secure a sale. The language should be friendly and informative, showcasing a genuine passion for Latin American cuisine. The conversation should end with the teacher expressing a strong interest in placing an order. The format should be a back-and-forth dialogue with clear distinctions between the student's and teacher's speaking parts.

original_prompt: After a patient has been discharged from the hospital with COPD, can you share what an example followup call with a case manger a patient might be.  Patient name is jack and the case manager is laura
instruction: After a patient has been discharged from the hospital with COPD, can you share what an example followup call with a case manger a patient might be.  Patient name is jack and the case manager is laura
base_response:
You are a case management specialist. Develop a script for a follow-up phone call from case manager Laura to patient Jack, who was recently discharged from the hospital after being treated for a COPD exacerbation. The call should occur 3 days post-discharge. Include the following sections in the script:

*   **Introduction:** Laura introduces herself, states her role, and confirms she's speaking with Jack.
*   **Check-in:** Laura inquires about Jack's current condition, including any new or worsening symptoms (e.g., shortness of breath, cough, wheezing), pain levels, and overall well-being.
*   **Medication Review:** Laura reviews Jack's current medications, dosage, and frequency, confirming he understands how to take them. Include a check on whether he has refills.
*   **Action Plan Review:** Laura asks Jack to review his discharge instructions and action plan for COPD management. Confirm he understands the plan and is following it.
*   **Appointment Check:** Inquire if Jack has followed up with scheduled appointments (e.g., pulmonologist, primary care physician, physical therapy).
*   **Resource and Support:** Offer resources for COPD management (e.g., pulmonary rehabilitation, support groups, smoking cessation programs, access to oxygen if applicable).
*   **Barriers and Concerns:** Inquire if Jack is experiencing any barriers to care (e.g., transportation, financial constraints, inability to understand the treatment plan).
*   **Next Steps:** Laura outlines the next steps, including any follow-up calls or appointments, and provides her contact information.
*   **Closing:** Laura concludes the call, offering ongoing support and encouragement.

The script should be written in a clear, empathetic, and patient-centered manner. Format the script with each section clearly labeled.

original_prompt: Should my Advanced Corporate Finance group select Pfizer or United Airlines for its group project?
instruction: Should my Advanced Corporate Finance group select Pfizer or United Airlines for its group project?
base_response:
Compose a detailed analysis comparing Pfizer (PFE) and United Airlines (UAL) as potential subjects for an Advanced Corporate Finance group project. Consider the following aspects:

*   **Financial Performance:** Analyze key financial metrics over the past 5 years (e.g., revenue growth, profitability margins, debt levels, free cash flow, return on equity). Include data sources.
*   **Industry Dynamics:** Discuss the competitive landscape, regulatory environment, and major trends impacting each industry (pharmaceuticals vs. airline).
*   **Investment Opportunities:** Evaluate potential investment opportunities or strategic decisions that could be analyzed (e.g., M&A, capital allocation, new product development).
*   **Valuation Analysis:** Conduct a preliminary valuation for each company using at least two different methods (e.g., discounted cash flow, comparable company analysis).
*   **Project Complexity and Data Availability:** Assess the complexity of each company for a student project and the availability of relevant data.

Conclude with a recommendation, justifying which company (Pfizer or United Airlines) is better suited for an Advanced Corporate Finance group project, based on the criteria above.

Output Format: A well-structured report with clearly labeled sections and sub-sections. Include tables, charts, and citations to support your analysis. The report should be approximately 1500-2000 words.

original_prompt:
There have been 2 huge earthquakes 7.4 and 7.6 on the richter scale 9 hours apart. There is widespread destruction in 10 major cities with millions of people and also in neighboring towns and villages. The earthquake happened in the middle of winter with snow and freezing temperatures. In the early hours there have already been 1500 deaths and 10000 wounded. 
In response to this disaster, the national government has declared a state of emergency, sending the military and search and rescue teams to the affected areas. Emergency shelters have been set up for those affected, and humanitarian aid is being sent from around the world. The government is also working to provide medical help to the wounded, shelter for those left homeless, and food and water to those in need. 
The long-term effects of the earthquakes are still unknown, but it is clear that this disaster has had a devastating impact on the region. The government is doing its best to provide aid and help to those affected, and many countries have offered aid and assistance to help with the recovery process. It is important that we all work together to support the affected people and communities in any way we can.
What would the initial needs be of the survivors under these conditions?

instruction: What would the initial needs be of the survivors under these conditions?
base_response:
You are an expert in disaster response planning. Given the following scenario, detail the immediate and critical needs of the survivors: Two massive earthquakes, measuring 7.4 and 7.6 on the Richter scale, struck a region with widespread destruction in 10 major cities and numerous towns and villages. The events occurred 9 hours apart. The disaster unfolded in the middle of winter, with snow and freezing temperatures. Initial reports indicate 1500 fatalities and 10,000 injuries. The national government has declared a state of emergency, deploying military and search and rescue teams. Emergency shelters are being established, and international humanitarian aid is en route.

Specifically, provide a bulleted list of the top 10 most urgent needs of the survivors within the first 24-72 hours. Each bullet point should concisely describe a specific need, including any relevant considerations due to the winter conditions and scale of the disaster. Prioritize these needs based on immediate life-saving and safety requirements.

instruction: !I have an excel with a list of emails (ex. jos@gmail.com), in 7 different excel tabs I have a list of users (firstname, lastname and email). I want a field next to the list of emails with the names found in the other tabs. what functions do I need?This content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
base_response:
```
You are an Excel expert. I have a single Excel file. In the first tab ("Emails"), I have a single column, "Email Addresses" (e.g., jos@gmail.com), containing a list of email addresses. In seven other tabs (named "Tab2", "Tab3", "Tab4", "Tab5", "Tab6", "Tab7", and "Tab8"), I have lists of users with three columns: "First Name", "Last Name", and "Email". I need to add a new column to the "Emails" tab, titled "Matching Names". This "Matching Names" column should contain the "First Name Last Name" of the user(s) found in the other seven tabs whose email address matches the email address in the "Email Addresses" column of the "Emails" tab. If multiple matches are found across the seven tabs, list all matching names separated by a comma. If no match is found, the cell in the "Matching Names" column should be left blank. Provide the specific Excel formulas, including the tab references and cell ranges, needed to accomplish this. Clearly explain the formula logic and where to enter the formulas in the "Emails" tab. Assume all data starts in row 2 of each tab.
```

original_prompt: write ionic 3 code that saving an image to gallery in android and ios
instruction: write ionic 3 code that saving an image to gallery in android and ios
base_response:
Write Ionic 3 code for a mobile application that allows a user to save an image from a URL to the device's gallery on both Android and iOS platforms.

Specifically:

1.  **Image Source:** Accept an image URL as input (e.g., from a hardcoded value or an input field - assume a hardcoded URL for simplicity).
2.  **Error Handling:** Implement robust error handling to gracefully manage potential issues, such as network errors, file I/O errors, and permission issues (e.g., gallery access denied). Display user-friendly error messages.
3.  **Permissions:** Ensure the necessary permissions are requested and handled to access the device's gallery. Include code to check for and request permissions if they are not granted.
4.  **Progress Indicator:** Display a progress indicator (e.g., a loading spinner) while the image is being saved to provide feedback to the user.
5.  **Success Notification:** Upon successful image saving, display a success message or notification to the user, confirming that the image has been saved.
6.  **Code Structure:** Organize the code logically, with clear comments and proper use of Angular/Ionic components and services. Focus on reusability.
7.  **Output Format:** Provide a complete, self-contained Ionic 3 component/page, including the relevant HTML, TypeScript (.ts), and any required imports. Assume the component's name is `ImageSaverComponent`. The code should be ready to be dropped into an Ionic 3 project.
8.  **Dependencies**: Specify any necessary Ionic or Cordova plugins and their installation commands (e.g., `cordova plugin add ...`).
9. **Testing**: Briefly mention how the solution could be tested, whether on a real device or an emulator/simulator.

original_prompt: Hello there, how can I create a Google Sheets Script to read a list of number that will be in a single column and generate a HQL query to insert all of these numbers into a Hive table.
instruction: Hello there, how can I create a Google Sheets Script to read a list of number that will be in a single column and generate a HQL query to insert all of these numbers into a Hive table.
base_response:
Develop a Google Sheets Script using Apps Script to automate the generation of Hive Query Language (HQL) INSERT statements. The script should read a list of numerical values from a single column (e.g., Column A) in a specified Google Sheet. Assume the input values are integers.

1.  **Sheet and Column Specification:** Allow the user to specify the Google Sheet ID and the column containing the numbers (e.g., 'Sheet1' and 'A').
2.  **HQL Generation:**  The script should generate HQL INSERT statements, incorporating each number from the specified column into a single Hive table. The script needs to wrap each number inside parentheses and separate them using commas in the VALUES clause.
3.  **Hive Table Configuration:**  Assume the Hive table name is 'my_hive_table' and the column name to insert into is 'my_column'.
4.  **Output Format:** The generated HQL query should be displayed in a single cell (e.g., cell B1) in the same Google Sheet. The output format should be a valid HQL statement.
5.  **Error Handling:** Include basic error handling, such as displaying an error message if the specified sheet or column doesn't exist or if no numbers are found.
6.  **Code Comments:**  The generated script should be well-commented to explain each step.

original_prompt: I am a professor who has assigned a group project to my students. Some students are upset because one person in their group is not contributing. What are some proven strategies to ensure all students contribute to their group in an equitable way?
instruction: I am a professor who has assigned a group project to my students. Some students are upset because one person in their group is not contributing. What are some proven strategies to ensure all students contribute to their group in an equitable way?
base_response:
You are an experienced professor specializing in group dynamics and project management. You've assigned a collaborative project to your students and are facing complaints about uneven contributions from group members. Your goal is to identify and implement strategies to ensure equitable participation and accountability within these groups.

Develop a comprehensive list of at least five (5) proven strategies, backed by research or practical examples, to address this issue. Each strategy should include:

1.  **A clear description of the strategy.**
2.  **Specific steps for implementation, tailored for a university setting.**
3.  **Potential benefits of the strategy.**
4.  **Potential drawbacks or challenges.**
5.  **One (1) concrete example of how the strategy could be applied to a specific type of group project (e.g., presentation, research paper, software development).**

Format your response as a numbered list, with each strategy presented in a separate section. Use concise and professional language, suitable for inclusion in a faculty resource document.

Hey Assistant, I need your help creating Midjourney command for AI Art Suffixes. 
 
The command for this kind of suffix should be in this format.
 
`/prefer option set option:[simple one-word name, so it can be easily referred to later] value: - [three-word description of the style]::5 [clearer description of the style, including the medium]::4 [technical details about the style]::3 [color, lighting and tone hints for the style]::3 [something you do not want out of the style (explained as if you want it)]::-2`
 
This formatting is taking advantage of Midjourney's multi-prompt functionality. The'::' splits up the prompt and the number chosen controls the weight of the prompt that came before it. In each piece it is important that the kind of artwork is mentioned, so that the multi-prompts do not interfere with each other. Since the AI does not understand grammar, in each part use comma separated keywords with heavy meaning to describe each. 
 
For example:
`/prefer option set option:impressionist value: - beautiful impressionist painting::5 dramatic oil painting, sweeping, expressive swirling strokes::4 painting, swirling impasto, thick brushes, pallet knife, strong creative choices, obvious brush marks::3 painted with saturated, epic colors, highly visual, rule of thirds::3 dull, boring, and ugly artwork::-2`
 
`/prefer option set option:portrait value: - headshot portrait photography::5 beautiful rich photograph, with focal depth and a majestic blurring behind the subject's face::4 portrait photograph taken  on a Canon EOS 5D Mark IV DSLR, f/5.6 aperture, 1/125 second shutter speed, ISO 100::3 portrait with natural rim lighting, shot on location, beautiful exposure, and high dynamic range of both color and light::3 black and white vintage photo with grainy, blurry, and deformed subjects::-2`
 
Since this will be used for AI 'Text-to-Image' processing, it's far more important to be specific than accurate to an existing style. Make bold and interesting choices when you invent your own art style.
 
Please start by describing a visually appealing art style with clear detail so someone would be inspired to try the command. (Write in the format of persuasive ad copy) Then provide the command itself (as a code block so it can be easily copy and pasted). Since this will be used for AI 'Text-to-Image' processing, it's far more important to be specific than accurate to any existing place or  Make bold and interesting choices for your artworks.
 
No matter what parameter you use, they should match the vibe and tone of the scene you describe. For best results, please only make landscapes and architecture for these styles.

I will use these as wallpapers so please make the aspect ratio 16:9.
